replumbo: <entryFree id="n41204" type="main" key="re^plumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-plumbo</orth>, no <sense id="n41204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to free from lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unsolder</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32" default="NO">34, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
replumis: <entryFree id="n41205" type="hapax" key="re^plu_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-plūmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pluma</etym>, <sense id="n41205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered again with feathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fledged anew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus (aquilae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 857</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repluo: <entryFree id="n41206" type="hapax" key="re^plu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-plŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rain down again</hi>: caelo, Musa ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5 praef.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
repo: <entryFree id="n41207" type="main" key="re_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/rpw;</foreign> Sanscr. root sarp-, creep; cf. Lat. serpo, serpens</etym>, <sense id="n41207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawl</hi> (cf. serpo). </sense><sense id="n41207.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41207.2" n="1" level="3"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">repens animans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae inter saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">millipeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muraenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 20, 37, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volpecula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">elephas genibus in catervas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 20</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41207.3" n="2" level="3"> Of creeping children, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:427" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 427</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41207.4" n="3" level="3"> Of other persons in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quā unus homo inermis vix poterat repere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super altitudinem fastigii (templi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 20, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrrho regi, quo die periit, praecisa hostiarum capita repsisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 197</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41207.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawl</hi>, of persons travelling slowly: <cit><quote lang="la">milia tum pransi tria repimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>.—Of persons swimming: <cit><quote lang="la">qui flumen repunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>.— Of cranes slowly stalking, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 545 Vahl.).—Of boats moving slowly along: aequore in alto ratibus repentibus, <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> (Enn.?) ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 23</bibl> Müll. (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 87</bibl> Vahl.; <cit><quote lang="la">Trag. Rel. p. 292 Rib.).—Of water flowing slowly: aqua palustris, quae pigro lapsu repit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of clouds,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1121</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of fire: ignis per artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 661</bibl></cit>.—Of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:16:4" default="NO">16, 4</bibl>: genus cucurbitarum, <cb n="REPO" /> quod humi repit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 39, § 82</bibl>.—Of movable towers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 458</bibl>.—Of the stealthy advance of a snare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41207.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones Repentes per humum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>low</tr>, <tr>common</tr>, <tr>mean</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 251</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repolio: <entryFree id="n41208" type="main" key="re^po^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clean again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta (with repurgare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
repondero: <entryFree id="n41209" type="main" key="re^ponde^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pondĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh in return;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to repay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">studii vicissitudinem tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro falsitate alicui veritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repono: <entryFree id="n41210" type="main" key="re^po_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n41210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> reposivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 16</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> sync. repostus, a, um, on account of the metre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:346" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 346</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 527</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">655</bibl>; 11, 149; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:507 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 507 al.</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set back</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n41210.1" n="I" level="1"> With the idea of the <hi rend="ital">re</hi> predominant. </sense><sense id="n41210.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set a</hi> thing <hi rend="ital">back in its former place; to replace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, etc. (class.; syn. remitto). </sense><sense id="n41210.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suo quemque loco lapidem reponeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicque suo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <trans><tr>the earth dug from a pit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in thesauris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 15</bibl></cit> Weissenb.; 31, 13; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta templorum in pristinis sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infans repositus in cunas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa in suas sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur ne difficulter reponatur vel repositum excidat,</quote> <trans><tr>set again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 10, 7</bibl>: se in cubitum, <hi rend="ital">to lean on the elbow again</hi> (at table), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne regium, quod ille de suo capite abjecerat, reposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantundem inaurati aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam,</quote> <trans><tr>to gather up again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:149" default="NO">11, 3, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">22: excussus curru ac rursus repositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in sceptra,</quote> <trans><tr>to reinstate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 253</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reges per bella pulsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:487" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem solio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:742" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniet qui nos in lucem reponat dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi des nummos sexcentos quos continuo tibi reponam hoc triduo aut quadriduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam nihil reposuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammis ambesa reponunt Robora navigiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to replace</tr>, <tr>restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aris ignem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:558" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruptos vetustate pontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fora templaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissa urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas a plebe disjectas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:37:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 37, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so esp. freq. in Vergil, of the serving up of a second course, as of a renewed banquet: sublata pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plena pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina mensis (soon after, instaurare epulas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festas mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:88" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi frigidi et repositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring back; to replace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si quid titubaverint (testes), opportuna rursus interrogatione velut in gradum reponantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">excidentes unius admonitione verbi in memoriam reponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vera virtus, cum semel excidit, Curat reponi deterioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To represent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">describe again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repeat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula quae posci vult et spectata reponi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achillem (after Homer),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 120</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta paterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:66" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To repay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitemus, alios non facere injuriam, sed reponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper ego auditor tantum? nunquamne reponam?</quote> <trans><tr>repay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.7" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To put back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontum et turbata litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:682" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 682</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">post otiosam et repositam vitam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bend backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay back</hi>: (grues) mollia crura reponunt, <hi rend="ital">bend back</hi> (in walking), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 545 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Virgil: pullus mollia crura reponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem reponunt et bracchium in latus jactant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tereti cervice repostā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim quartus (digitus) oblique reponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic potissimum et vocem flectunt et cervicem reponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra (mortui) toro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra stratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 392</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay aside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> for preservation; <hi rend="ital">to lay up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">store up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve</hi> (class.; cf.: regero, reservo). </sense><sense id="n41210.10" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: nec tempestive demetendi<pb n="1571" /> <cb n="REPO" />  percipiendique fructūs neque condendi ac reponendi ulla pecudum scientia est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formicae farris acervum tecto reponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecubum ad festas dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella in vetustatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:7" default="NO">12, 44, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alimenta in hiemem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(caseum) hiemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae multo ante memor provisa repones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesaurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta in aliquod tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem (gratia) sequitur tellure repostos, i. e. conditos,</quote> <trans><tr>buried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 655</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an poteris siccis mea fata reponere ocellis? (= me mortuum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu pias laetis animas reponis Sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repono infelix lacrimas, et tristia carmina servo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:47" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est studio praecedente et acquisitā facultate et quasi repositā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">29: aliquid scriptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manet altā mente repostum Judicium Paridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reponere odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensibus haec imis ... reponas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.12" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put in the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi> one thing for another (class.). </sense><sense id="n41210.13" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non puto te meas epistulas delere, ut reponas tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristophanem pro Eupoli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorumque in vicem idonea reponenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira ne sedes vacet, monstrum repone majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 122" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.14" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">at vero praeclarum diem illis reposuisti, Verria ut agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.15" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put away.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41210.16" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">remum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caestus artemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feretro reposto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telasque calathosque infectaque pensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:507" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 507</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus sumptas figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <trans><tr>to let down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:279" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 279</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam falcem arbusta reponunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>permit to be laid aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 416</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41210.17" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevem fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to end the flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:592" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 592</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 649</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41210.18" n="II" level="1"> With the idea of the verb predominant, <hi rend="ital">to lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi> a thing anywhere (freq. and class.; syn. colloco). </sense><sense id="n41210.19" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">grues in tergo praevolantium colla et capita reponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla in plumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras in gremio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc celso in ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:339" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna super foco Large reponens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nidum) ante fores sacras reponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 407</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas in vasa nova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">data sunt legatis, quae in aerarium reposuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulos in locellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mergum altius in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 205</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41210.20" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set; to place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vestrā mansuetudine atque humanitate causam totam repono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:33:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 33, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos meam defensionem in aliquo artis loco reponetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos hortatur, ut spem omnem in virtute reponant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in se omnem spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil spei in caritate civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem ac libertatem in illorum armis dextrisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum honorem non in splendore titulorum, sed in judiciis hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:84:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 84, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus in duce quam in exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus in deo quam in viribus reponentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:8:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiduciam in re reponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea facta, quae in obscuritate et silentio reponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos equidem in deorum immortalium coetu ac numero repono,</quote> <trans><tr>place</tr>, <tr>count</tr>, <tr>reckon among</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:68:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 68, 143</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sidera in deorum numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 47</bibl> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catulum in clarissimorum hominum numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:90:section=210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 90, § 210</bibl></cit>: aliquem in suis, Antonius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl>, A, 1.— With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines morte deletos in deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in deorum numerum reponemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isocratem hunc in numerum non repono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in fabularum numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 39</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc partem in numerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ejus sinum rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŏsĭ-tus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕpostus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n41210.21" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant</hi> (syn. remotus; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): penitusque repostas Massylum gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="REPO" /> 325: <cit><quote lang="la">convalles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 145, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41210.22" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Laid aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stored up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona justitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, Tim. 4, 8.</sense></entryFree>
reporrigo: <entryFree id="n41211" type="hapax" key="re^porri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-porrĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to reach forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hand again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phialam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 51, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reporto: <entryFree id="n41212" type="main" key="re^porto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-porto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring back</hi> (class.; syn. refero). </sense><sense id="n41212.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41212.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: alii vini amphoras, quas plenas tulerunt, eas argento repletas domum reportaverunt, C. Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 12, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aurum ab Theotimo domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabrum secum in Syriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia opima Feretrio Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves, quibus (milites) reportari possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites navibus in Siciliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum duobus commeatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones classe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum Britanniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:24" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres Lolliae Paulinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrae massam picis urbe reportat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum me reporto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 114, 5</bibl></cit>: se ad Didium, <hi rend="ital">to return</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 40, 2; for which, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reportare pedem (with redire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 764</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with an inanimate subject: <cit><quote lang="la">quos variae viae reportant,</quote> <trans><tr>lead back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41212.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as a victor, <hi rend="ital">to carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear away; to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi> (cf. deporto): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ex praedā domum suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a rege insignia victoriae, non victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil praeter laudem neque ex hostibus, neque a sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam ex proconsulatu Asiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veram ac solidam gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:16:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphum (imperator), Plin. praef. § 30: praedam ac manubias suas ad decemviros, tamquam ad dominos, reportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 264, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non reducti sumus in patriam, sicut nonnulli clarissimi cives, sed equis insignibus et curru aurato reportati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 11, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41212.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41212.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex litibus aestimatis tuis pecuniam domum, sed ex tuā calamitate cineri atque ossibus filii sui solatium vult aliquod reportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem bonam certamque domum reporto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:74" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Echo) Ingeminat voces auditaque verba reportat,</quote> <trans><tr>gives back</tr>, <tr>returns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium parentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:14:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41212.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to bring back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry back</hi> an account; <hi rend="ital">to report</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): adytis haec tristia dicta reportat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 5), 37: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <trans><tr>a certain account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud mollia ad socerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 323, 29</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius ingentes ignotā in veste reportat Advenisse viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 167</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reposco: <entryFree id="n41213" type="main" key="re^posco1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-posco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to demand back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ask for again</hi>, as something belonging to one (class.); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid; aliquid ab aliquo;</hi> more freq., <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquid</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41213.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedisti eam dono mihi: Eandem nunc reposcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi talentum mutuom dedi, reposcam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae deposueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes commissos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 53: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem clamore magno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:460" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ab hac puerum reposcam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulam auri te reposco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum vidulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum simulacrum Cereris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter me Catilinam reposcebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthos signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(talenta) Thebani reposcunt Thessalos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propensiores ad bene merendum quam ad reposcendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41213.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ask for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">claim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi>, as something due: <cit><quote lang="la">attentas aures animumque reposco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:920" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 920</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod natura reposcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam (mea fata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:71" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissam meā virtutem voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa Ordine cuncta suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:38:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natos poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 139</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc. (Heyne, ad poenas): <cit><quote lang="la">ab altero rationem vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: rationem (rei) ab <cb n="REPR" /> aliquo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos rationem reposcitis, quid Achaei Lacedaemoniis bello victis fecerimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicturos reposcentibus aut prospera aut adversa,</quote> <trans><tr>who demanded an account of their successes or reverses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave respuas, Ne poenas Nemesis reposcat a te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41214" type="hapax" key="re^posco2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕposco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. reposco</etym>, <sense id="n41214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes a demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who urges a claim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repositio: <entryFree id="n41215" type="main" key="re^po^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repono, I. C.</etym>, <sense id="n41215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storing up</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">faeni, palearum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repositorium: <entryFree id="n41216" type="main" key="re^po^si^to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŏsĭtōrĭum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpostōrium</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 17</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>repono</etym>, <sense id="n41216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in which any thing is placed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">laid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41216.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tray</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">waiter</hi> on which the dishes were brought to the table, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 33 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:146" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 11, 52, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 5, § 26</bibl>; 18, 35, 90, § 365; cf. Becker, Gallus, 1, p. 177; 3, p. 216 (2d edit.). — </sense><sense id="n41216.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A repository</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cabinet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repositorium sanctius Hadriani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 17, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repositus: <entryFree id="n41217" type="main" key="re^po^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of repono, q. v. <sense id="n41217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
repostor: <entryFree id="n41218" type="hapax" key="re^postor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpostor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>repono, I. A.</etym>, <sense id="n41218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restorer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repostorium: <entryFree id="n41219" type="main" key="re^posto_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpostōrium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. repositorium.</entryFree>
repostus: <entryFree id="n41220" type="main" key="re^postus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpostus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of repono.</entryFree>
repotatio: <entryFree id="n41221" type="spur" key="re^po_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpōtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, a false read. for repotia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 84</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl>, § 122.</entryFree>
repotia: <entryFree id="n41222" type="main" key="re^po_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pōtĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>poto</etym>, an after-drinking, i. e., <sense id="n41222.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A drinking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carousing on the day after an entertainment</hi>, at a wedding, a birth, or other festive occasion. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 60</bibl> Acro; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Fest. s. h. v. pp. 137 and 231; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=122" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 122</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, § 84 Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 27 (2d edit.).— </sense><sense id="n41222.1" n="II" level="1"> In Appuleius, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the drinking after a banquet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 312, 30</bibl></cit>: convivii, id. de Mundo, p. 74, 19.</sense></entryFree>
repperi: <entryFree id="n41223" type="main" key="repperi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">repperi</orth>, v. reperio.</entryFree>
repraesentaneus: <entryFree id="n41224" type="hapax" key="re^praesenta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-praesentānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n41224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">present</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repraesentatio: <entryFree id="n41225" type="main" key="re^praesenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpraesentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repraesento</etym>. <sense id="n41225.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bringing before one; a showing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifesting; a representation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">plus est evidentia, vel ut alii dicunt, repraesentatio, quam perspicuitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paulus felicissimi patris repraesentatio,</quote> <trans><tr>the image</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:10:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41225.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to repraesento, II.) <usg type="dom">Mercant. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cash payment</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repraesentator: <entryFree id="n41226" type="hapax" key="re^praesenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpraesentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a representative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris (filius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repraesento: <entryFree id="n41227" type="main" key="re^praesento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-praesento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41227.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring before one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring back; to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">per quas (visiones) imagines rerum absentium ita repraesentantur animo, ut eas cernere oculis ac praesentes habere videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae vis repraesentat aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 28, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod templum repraesentabat memoriam consulatūs mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: si quis vultu torvo ferus simulet Catonem, Virtutemne repraesentet moresque Catonis? * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillitatem ingenii mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movendi ratio aut in repraesentandis est aut imitandis adfectibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis species repraesentabatur animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">affectum patris amissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et vera esse et apte ad repraesentandam iram deūm ficta possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina,</quote> <trans><tr>to recite</tr>, <tr>repeat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 24, 24, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridem saporem olivarum etiam post annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem veri maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem constantius,</quote> <trans><tr>to show</tr>, <tr>exhibit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem olei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to supply the place of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 10, 45, § 160</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 14, 36, § 134</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41227.1" n="B" level="2"> Of painters, sculptors, etc., <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portray</hi>, etc. (post-Aug. for adumbro): <cit><quote lang="la">Niceratus repraesentavit Alcibiadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 88</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to present one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be present</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:26" default="NO">11, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:15:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 15, § 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41227.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., mercant. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to pay immediately</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on the spot; to pay in ready money</hi>: reliquae pecuniae vel usuram<pb n="1572" /> <cb n="REPR" />  Silio pendemus, dum a Faberio vel ab aliquo qui Faberio debet, repraesentabimus, <hi rend="ital">shall be enabled to pay immediately</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 2</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies promissorum adest: quem etiam repraesentabo, si adveneris,</quote> <trans><tr>shall even anticipate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. fideicommissum, <hi rend="ital">to discharge immediately</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in advance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 36</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41227.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">execute</hi> any act <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forthwith;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">not to defer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put off; to hasten</hi> (good prose): se, quod in longiorem diem collaturus esset, repraesentaturum et proximā nocte castra moturum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">festinasse se repraesentare consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petis a me, ut id quod in diem suum dixeram debere differri, repraesentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 1</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 119" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 119 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque exspectare temporis medicinam, quam repraesentare ratione possimus,</quote> <trans><tr>to apply it immediately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">improbitatem suam,</quote> <trans><tr>to hurry on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormenta poenasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5</bibl>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera et plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>to sing immediately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">si repraesentari morte meā libertas civitatis potest,</quote> <trans><tr>can be immediately recovered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minas irasque caelestes,</quote> <trans><tr>to fulfil immediately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia repraesentata,</quote> <trans><tr>held on the spot</tr>, <tr>without preparation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41227.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand in the place of</hi> (late Lat.): nostra per eum repraesentetur auctoritas, Greg. M. Ep. 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
reprehendo: <entryFree id="n41228" type="main" key="re^pre^hendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-prĕhendo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpraehendo, rĕ-prendo</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpraendo</orth>; cf. prehendo. Examples of the contracted form among the poets are, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 427, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:55 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 55 al.</bibl>), <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catch.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41228.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): ille reprehendit hunc priorem pallio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me pallio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi fugiunt, sed si reprehensi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti profugos et reprensos in catenis reducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensi ex fugā Persae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra rapi partim, partim reprensa relinqui,</quote> <trans><tr>caught fast</tr>, <tr>sticking behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 526</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41228.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41228.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen, <hi rend="ital">to hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain; to recover</hi> (rare, but found in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">revocat virtus, vel potius reprehendit manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ab exitio reprehendere euntes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes extremum cupiunt vitae reprehendere vinclum,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold fast</tr>, <tr>retain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 599</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id memori mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 858</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese (sensus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 497</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19</bibl> (4, 18), 9: <cit><quote lang="la">sed reprendi me tamen, Nequid de fratre garrulae illi dicerem,</quote> <trans><tr>have restrained myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: pernoscite, locum Reprehendere, <hi rend="ital">to recover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> what had been left out or omitted, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 14: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erat praetermissum, id reprehendisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:20:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 20, § 51</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41228.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi> an erring person or (more freq.) the error itself; hence, by meton., <hi rend="ital">to blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find fault with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprehend</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vituperor, criminor, increpo): cum in eodem genere, in quo ipsi offendissent, alios reprehendissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem qui reprehendit, in eo reprehendit, quod gratum praeter modum dicat esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 63</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">34, 84: si quos (aculeos) habuisti in me reprehendendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo non sum reprehendendus, sed etiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum discessum reprehendere et subaccusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod reprehendit Lauranius, Messala defendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem communi vituperatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil haberem quod reprehenderem, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res omnium judicio reprehendebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatem cupiditatemque militum, licentiam, arrogantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia aliena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus inertes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 292</bibl></cit>: cum de se loquitur, non <cb n="REPR" /> ut majore reprensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inspersos egregio reprendas corpore naevos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc ipso (Demosthene) reprehendit Aeschines quaedam et exagitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu id in me reprehendis, quod Q. Metello laudi datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes istius modi artes in iis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes albos in iis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil in magno Homero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 52</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">verum ea ne quis credat eo reprehendenda, quod multos cognovimus qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt inevitabiles soni, quibus nonnumquam nationes reprendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 33</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">visum te aiunt in regiā: nec reprehendo, quippe cum ipse istam reprehensionem non fugerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl></cit>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">quo plures det sibi tamquam ansas ad reprehendendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irridentis magis est quam reprehendentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 31, 75</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41228.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of public and formal condemnation, <hi rend="ital">to convict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass judgment on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multa vero injuste fleri possunt, quae nemo possit reprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si senatores judicent, hoc unum genus pecuniae per injuriam cogendae nullo modo posse reprehendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:96:section=223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 96, § 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id ullo modo senatoriis judiciis, reprehendi posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 96</bibl></cit>, § 224.— </sense><sense id="n41228.6" n="3" level="3"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">to refute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expone nunc de reprehendendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:12:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 12, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis argumentatio reprehenditur, si aut ex eis, quae sumpta sunt, non conceditur aliquid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:42:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 42, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. reprehensio, II. B. 2.</sense></entryFree>
reprehensibilis: <entryFree id="n41229" type="main" key="re^pre^hensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-prĕhensĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reprehendo</etym>, <sense id="n41229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blamable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprehensible</hi> (late Lat.): ebrietas, Salv. Gub. Dei, 4, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 28, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reprehensio: <entryFree id="n41230" type="main" key="re^pre^hensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprĕhensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a holding back</hi>, trop. * </sense><sense id="n41230.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A checking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, in speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">(orationem) concinnam ... festivam, sine intermissione, sine reprehensione, sine varietate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41230.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprimand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprehension</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n41230.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam in morte debent ii, qui in re publicā versantur, non culpae reprehensionem et stultitiae vituperationem relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: temeritatis, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis neglegentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:10"
