default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereri reprehensionem doctorum atque prudentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscuritatis, infantiae, inscitiae rerum verborumque, et insulsitatis etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissentientium inter se reprehensiones non sunt vituperandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41230.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensionem non fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl></cit>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">justā reprehensione carere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine reprehensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:18" default="NO">1, 11, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:68" default="NO">9, 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1</bibl>, praef. § 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra reprehensionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:34" default="NO">8, 5, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reprehensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensionem capere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be found fault with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">fore ut hic noster labor in varias reprehensiones incurreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41230.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41230.6" n="1" level="3"> Like our <hi rend="ital">blame</hi> for the thing blamed, <hi rend="ital">a fault</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hermagoras, in plurimis admirandus, tantum diligentiae nimium solicitae, ut ipsa ejus reprehensio laude aliquā non indigna sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: usque ad emacitatis reprehensionem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41230.7" n="2" level="3"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a refutation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:42:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 42, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:12:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 12, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 34</bibl> (cf. reprehendo, II. B. 2.).</sense></entryFree>
reprehenso: <entryFree id="n41231" type="main" key="re^pre^henso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprĕhenso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold back continually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain from time to time</hi> (very rare, perh. <foreign lang="greek">a(/p. ei)r</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensans singulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
reprehensor: <entryFree id="n41232" type="main" key="re^pre^hensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprĕhensor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blamer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprehender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">restat unum genus reprehensorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id factum non accusatore tantum, sed etiam reprehensore caruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reprehensus: <entryFree id="n41233" type="main" key="re^pre^hensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprĕhensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from reprehendo.</entryFree>
reprendo: <entryFree id="n41234" type="main" key="re^prendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. reprehendo.</entryFree>
represse: <entryFree id="n41235" type="main" key="re^presse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpressē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. reprimo <sense id="n41235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
repressor: <entryFree id="n41236" type="main" key="re^pressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpressor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reprimo</etym>, <sense id="n41236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restrainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represser; a limiter</hi> (very rare): caedis cottidianae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repressus: <entryFree id="n41237" type="main" key="re^pressus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of reprimo.</entryFree>
reprimo: <entryFree id="n41238" type="main" key="re^pri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-prĭmo</orth>, <itype>pressi, pressum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="REPR" /> <hi rend="ital">press back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep back; to check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi> (class., partic. in the trop. sense; cf.: repello, refuto). </sense><sense id="n41238.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: illa praedicta Veientium, si lacus Albanus redundasset, Romam periturum; <cit><quote lang="la">si repressus esset, Veios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:522" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta reprimentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:16:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 16, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvas procidentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:939" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 939</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:309" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro pedem cum voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 378</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of personal objects: represso jam Lucterio et remoto,</quote> <trans><tr>forced back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem repressum, non oppressum relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15, 32</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41238.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (the figure borrowed from the restraining, confining of a stream), <hi rend="ital">to check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilem quandam temperantiam postulant in eo, quod semel admissum coërceri reprimique non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem exsultantem reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:44:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 44, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego hanc rei publicae pestem paulisper reprimi, non in perpetuum comprimi posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria, non exstincta, sed repressa vetustate,</quote> <trans><tr>suppressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 30, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus hostium repressos esse intellegunt ac retardatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis regios spiritus repressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi incitationem atque alacritatem non reprimere sed augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc reprimam susceptam objurgationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 9</bibl></cit> (15): <cit><quote lang="la">illius conatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem peccandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">53: fletum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 163</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">odium suum a corpore alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 12, 27</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: ast occasus ubi tempusve audere repressit, <hi rend="ital">the bold undertaking</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> p. 178</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 292 Vahl.).— <cit><quote lang="la">Of personal objects: quem neque fides, neque jusjurandum ... Repressit,</quote> <trans><tr>has restrained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ... horum aspectus in ipso cursu orationis repressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem L. Murena repressum magnā ex parte, non oppressum reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 32</bibl></cit>: reprimam me, ne aegre quicquam ex me audias, <hi rend="ital">I will control myself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi> or <hi rend="ital">restrain myself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 38</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac repressi castigatione in proelium redeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mid.: vix reprimor, quin te manere jubeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab omni contagione vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:83:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 83, 2</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpressē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with restraint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrainedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repressius peccare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:11:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repressius actum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reprobaticius: <entryFree id="n41239" type="gloss" key="re^pro^ba_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprŏbātīcĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)podokimaste/os,</foreign> Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
reprobatio: <entryFree id="n41240" type="main" key="re^pro^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprŏbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reprobo</etym>, <sense id="n41240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rejection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprobation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 7, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reprobatrix: <entryFree id="n41241" type="main" key="re^pro^ba_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprŏbātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reprobator</etym>, <sense id="n41241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that condemns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reprobates</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">superbiae (disciplina),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reprobo: <entryFree id="n41242" type="main" key="re^pro^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-prŏbo</orth>, no <sense id="n41242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to disapprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condemn</hi> (post-Aug.; not in Cicero, for in Fin. 1, 7, 23, the correct reading is: et probet, v. Madv. ad h. l.; and in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl>, prooem. § 3, Halm reads: dis repugnantibus, v. Madv. l. l.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: reicio, repudio, respuo): statuae reprobatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:4:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 20, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reprobus: <entryFree id="n41243" type="main" key="re^pro^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-prŏbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n41243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nummi, pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines circa fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repromissio: <entryFree id="n41244" type="main" key="re^pro_missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprōmissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repromitto</etym>, in business lang., <sense id="n41244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counter-promise</hi> (syn. restipulatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 39</bibl>, and 18, 56; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 29, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 4, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repromissor: <entryFree id="n41245" type="main" key="re^pro_misso^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕprōmissŏr</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who answers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">promises</hi> in return; <hi rend="ital">a surety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 29, 21 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae aeternae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fid. 4, 11, 154</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repromitto: <entryFree id="n41246" type="main" key="re^pro_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-prōmitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41246.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, mercant. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to promise in return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to engage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bind one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repromittam istoc tibi nomine solutam rem futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41246.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to promise in</hi> <pb n="1573" /> <cb n="REPU" /> <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non mehercule, inquit, tibi repromittere istuc quidem ausim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: ad hunc gustum totum librum repromitto. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n41246.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To promise again</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperaturum repromittens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repropitio: <entryFree id="n41247" type="main" key="re^pro^pi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-prŏpĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to propitiate again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make propitiation for</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">imagines Caesarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 19, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu repropitiaberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 8, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reptabundus: <entryFree id="n41248" type="main" key="repta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">reptābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>repto</etym>, <sense id="n41248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">creeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawling</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">effusus in voluptates, reptabundus (al. vagabundus) semper atque ebrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(virtutem) ex intervallo ingenti reptabundus sequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 18</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. ructabundus).</sense></entryFree>
reptatio: <entryFree id="n41249" type="hapax" key="repta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">reptātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a creeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantium per manus et genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reptatus: <entryFree id="n41250" type="main" key="repta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">reptātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a creeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawling</hi> (post-Aug., and only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n41250.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumans limacum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n41250.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reptilis: <entryFree id="n41251" type="main" key="repti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">reptĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>repo</etym>, <sense id="n41251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">creeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reptile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">reptĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a reptile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repto: <entryFree id="n41252" type="main" key="repto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">repto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n41252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawl</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.; a favorite word with Claud.). </sense><sense id="n41252.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41252.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals and men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 50, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chamaeleon humi reptans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis reptans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Stil. 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rufin. 1, 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Eutr. 2, 443 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n41252.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons walking slowly or lazily: major pars populi aridi reptant fame, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of beasts: pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an tacitum silvas inter reptare salubris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per limitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 26, 2</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of plants,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 69</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41252.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crawl through.</hi> So only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rep-tātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">crept</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crawled through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager (ab angue),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:581" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Creta tenero Tonanti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 134</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis tenero Achilli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rufin. 2, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delos geminis numinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. Theod. 4" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. Theod. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
repubesco: <entryFree id="n41253" type="main" key="re^pu_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pūbesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow young again;</hi> trop., with revirescere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repudiatio: <entryFree id="n41254" type="main" key="re^pu^di^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŭdĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repudio</etym>, <sense id="n41254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rejection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refusal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdaining</hi> (rare, but good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">supplicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fideicommissi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 42, 26</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi simulatio pro repudiatione fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 51, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repudiator: <entryFree id="n41255" type="hapax" key="re^pu^di^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŭdĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rejecter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Creatoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repudio: <entryFree id="n41256" type="main" key="re^pu^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŭdĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>repudium</etym>, t. t. <sense id="n41256.0" n="A" level="2"> Of persons married or betrothed, <hi rend="ital">to cast off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divorce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repudiate</hi> (cf. reicio): <cit><quote lang="la">sponsas admodum adulescens duas habuit ... priorem ... virginem adhuc repudiavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 79</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liviam repudiatam relegavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob hoc repudiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:31" default="NO">8, 5, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si repudiatur miles, mulier mecum perit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">repudiatus repetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulier marito) amatorium dedit, repudiavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudiari etiam futurum matrimonium potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:191" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41256.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse to accept</hi> an inheritance: <cit><quote lang="la">si heres bona repudiaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 14, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fideicommissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 31, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:77:section=31" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 31, 1, 77, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum a se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:5:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem defuncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:80" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 32, 1, 80</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41256.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse; to scorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repudiate</hi> (very freq. and good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: reprobo, aspernor, respuo): cujus vota et preces a vestris mentibus repudiare debetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium senatūs a re publicā,</quote> <trans><tr>to remove</tr>, <tr>withdraw from the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudia istos comites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitatem supplicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 20, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia haec forensis spreta a philosophis et repudiata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">repudiata rejectaque legatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus totum liberi populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="REPU" /> 4, 54; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 14, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrocinium voluptatis (corresp. to vituperare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimum dictionis genus funditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista securitas multis locis repudianda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundia omnibus in rebus repudianda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus, quam sequitur caritas, minime repudianda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŭdĭātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŭ-dĭāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a divorced wife</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem vidua, vel repudiata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 22, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 30, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:44:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 44, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repudiosus: <entryFree id="n41257" type="hapax" key="re^pu^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>repudium</etym>, <sense id="n41257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that ought to be rejected</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disdained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiae,</quote> <trans><tr>scandalous</tr>, <tr>offensive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 56</bibl></cit> Ritschl.</sense></entryFree>
repudium: <entryFree id="n41258" type="main" key="re^pu^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pŭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pudet</etym>, t. t., of married or betrothed parties, <sense id="n41258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putting away</hi> of the opposite party; <hi rend="ital">a dissolution of the marriage contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divorce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repudiation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter divortium et repudium hoc interest, quod repudiari etiam futurum matrimonium potest, non recte autem sponsa divertisse dicitur, quando divortium ex eo dictum est, quod in diversas partes eunt, qui discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:191" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 191</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">divortium inter virum et uxorem fieri dicitur, repudium vero sponsae remitti videtur, quod et in uxoris personam non absurde cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:101" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 101</bibl></cit> (Cic. uses only divortium, v. h. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiare repudium sponsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:53 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 53 sq.</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: repudium (sponsae) remittere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 383, 20</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 35</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">remittere uxori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere mulieribus absentium maritorum nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Maevia repudium misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Lepidus Appuleiae uxoris caritate post repudium obiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 36, 36, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudio dimittere uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:11:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:7:1" default="NO">9, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam repudii dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudium inter uxorem et virum nullum intercessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellum repudii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 31 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24</bibl>, tit. 2: De divortiis et repudiis.—</sense><sense id="n41258.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">amphitheatri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repuerasco: <entryFree id="n41259" type="main" key="re^pu^e^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pŭĕrasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become a boy again.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41259.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quia repuerascis, Novat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 165, 25</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 215 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis mihi deus largiatur, ut ex hac aetate repuerascam et in cunis vagiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41259.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become childish;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">to play</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frolic like a child</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laelium semper fere cum Scipione solitum rusticari, eosque incredibiliter repuerascere esse solitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repugnans: <entryFree id="n41260" type="main" key="re^pugnans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpugnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. repugno.</entryFree>
repugnanter: <entryFree id="n41261" type="main" key="re^pugnanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpugnanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. repugno, <sense id="n41261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
repugnantia: <entryFree id="n41262" type="main" key="re^pugnanti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpugnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repugno</etym>. * <sense id="n41262.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A resistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposition;</hi> concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura) hanc dedit repugnantiam apibus (sc. cuspidem),</quote> <trans><tr>a means of defence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 13, 45, § 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41262.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contradiction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrariety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incompatibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repugnance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae (opp. concordiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repugnantiam inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 7, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41263" type="main" key="re^pugnanti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpugnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>repugno</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
repugnatio: <entryFree id="n41264" type="main" key="re^pugna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpugnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repugno</etym>, <sense id="n41264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a resistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repugnatorius: <entryFree id="n41265" type="hapax" key="re^pugna_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpugnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to resistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>means of defence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repugno: <entryFree id="n41266" type="main" key="re^pugno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pugno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fight against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose; to make resistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> (class.; syn.: adversor, resisto, renitor). </sense><sense id="n41266.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri primo integris viribus fortiter repugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in milit. lang.: repugnantes noctem diemque obsident,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cic. Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 91; Pompei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, C, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">1 and 3: in repugnando telis obruta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 749</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidanis non repugnantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41266.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make resistance; to oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contend</hi> <cb n="REPU" /> <hi rend="ital">against.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41266.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">catuli pantherarum unguibus ac pedibus morsuque repugnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1037" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1037</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de praedā (volucres),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1082" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1082</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catone acerrime repugnante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules neque concedebant neque valde repugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 13, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec bene dicuntur, nec ego repugno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversante et repugnante naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 110</bibl></cit>; so (with adversari) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with resistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:22" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ego repugno: sed inter sese ipsa pugnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41266.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego omnibus meis opibus ... repugnarim et restiterim crudelitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae (with obsistere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratri tuo (preceded by resistere fratri tuo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his perturbationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:319" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiae cuidam tamquam vanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui in ullā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi in hoc uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus voluntati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 294" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his omnibus rebus unum repugnabat, quod, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>one consideration opposed itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41266.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Other constructions: <cit><quote lang="la">resistere et repugnare contra veritatem non audet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 17, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa quae si is, qui instituetur, non repugnaverit, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shows himself not indocile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 5.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis, ne fias nostra, repugnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl> (al. ut).—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier prohibet se concipere atque repugnat,</quote> <trans><tr>and opposes it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1269</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1088" default="NO" valid="yes">1088</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare repugno Illum, quem fieri vix puto posse meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 137</bibl></cit>; cf. once in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et a vobis diversitas defendenda est, sicuti et a nobis repugnanda,</quote> <trans><tr>to be opposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41266.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41266.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To oppose</hi> with words, <hi rend="ital">advise against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id censuisset Cassius, Brutus repugnaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:58:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 58, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41266.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in the way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed syllaba contumax repugnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:11:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repugnat invidia furiosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41266.9" n="3" level="3"> To oppose from natural incongruity, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to disagree with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be contrary to;</hi> of several things compared together, <hi rend="ital">to be contradictory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsistent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incompatible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repugnant</hi> (so mostly only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid antecedit quamque rem, id cohaeret cum re necessario: et quicquid repugnat id ejusmodi est, ut cohaerere numquam possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:12:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 12, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatio amicitiae repugnat maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec inter se quam repugnent, plerique non vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repugnat recte accipere et invitum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam illud vehementer repugnat, eundem et beatum esse et multis malis oppressum. Haec quomodo conveniant, non sane intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:26:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 26, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus moresque repugnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 97</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpugnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repugnant; comp.</hi>: quo quid repugnantius dici possit, non video, Lact. Ira Dei, 9.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpugnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; in rhet., <hi rend="ital">contradictions</hi> (syn. contraria): <cit><quote lang="la">locus ex repugnantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:2" default="NO">5, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:31" default="NO">5, 11, 31</bibl>; 6, 3, 66.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpugnanter</orth> (acc. to repugno, II. A.), <hi rend="ital">unwillingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with repugnance</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid patienter accipere, non repugnanter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repullesco: <entryFree id="n41267" type="main" key="re^pullesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pullesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [pullus], <hi rend="ital">to bud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sprout forth again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:4" default="NO">4, 24, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repullulo: <entryFree id="n41268" type="main" key="re^pullu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pullŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sprout forth again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:241" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 44, 90, § 241</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 6</bibl>, n. 10.</sense></entryFree>
repulsa: <entryFree id="n41269" type="main" key="re^pulsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpulsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repello; prop. <mood>Part.</mood>, sc. petitio</etym>; publicists' t. t., <sense id="n41269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a refusal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi> in soliciting for an office: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonem veteres inimicitiae Caesaris incitant et dolor repulsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes magistratus sine repulsā assequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sine repulsā consules facti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sine repulsā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 21, 51</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, on the other hand: Laelii unum consulatum fuisse cum repulsā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 54</bibl></cit>: repulsam ferre, <hi rend="ital">to be rejected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lose one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s election</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 280</bibl>; so (the class. technical phrase) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:19:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 19, 3 al.</bibl>; cf.: <pb n="1574" /> <cb n="REPU" /> a populo repulsam ferre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsam referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamerco praetermissio aedilitatis consulatus repulsam attulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsam consulatūs pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. Theod. 12" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. Theod. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunciatā fratris repulsā in consulatus petitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 36, 36, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpis repulsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus, repulsae nescia sordidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsam solari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsā notatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego aedilicias repulsas colligo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 21, 52</bibl></cit> (cf. shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Marius duabus aedilitatibus repulsus): videntur offensionum et repulsarum quasi quandam ignominiam timere et infamiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis reliquere pericula, repulsas, judicia, egestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41269.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a rejection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refusal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Echedemus fatigatos tot repulsis Aetolos ad spem revocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: posce aliquid; <cit><quote lang="la">nullam patiere repulsam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 97</bibl></cit>: elige; <cit><quote lang="la">nullam patiere repulsam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 289</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sint tua vota secura repulsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:199" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor crescit dolore repulsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:395" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 395</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longae nulla repulsa morae,</quote> <trans><tr>no repulse caused by long delays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 26: <cit><quote lang="la">in hanc (tristitiam) omnis ira post repulsam revolvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignatio repulsae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 255, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repulsio: <entryFree id="n41270" type="main" key="re^pulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpulsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repello</etym>. <sense id="n41270.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a repelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resistance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentiae per vim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41270.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a refutation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
repulso: <entryFree id="n41271" type="main" key="re^pulso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pulso</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n41271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to drive back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repel again and again.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41271.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas eloquiis caelestibus magis quam corporis voluptatibus hostiles impetus repulsare consueta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 22, § 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n41271.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles verba repulsantes,</quote> <trans><tr>re-echoing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 579</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41271.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera repulsans pectus dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:914" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 914</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repulsor: <entryFree id="n41272" type="main" key="re^pulsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpulsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who repels</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drives back</hi>, Ambros. in Job, 4, 11, 29; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:in Psa. 118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 2, § 22.</sense></entryFree>
repulsorius: <entryFree id="n41273" type="main" key="re^pulso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpulsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">driving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forcing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulsory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpulsōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a means of driving back</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 4, § 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
repulsus: <entryFree id="n41274" type="main" key="re^pulsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of repello.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41275" type="main" key="re^pulsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpulsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>repello</etym>, <sense id="n41275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driving back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulsion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverberation</hi> (of light, sound, etc.; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; usually in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">(effigies) assiduo crebroque repulsu Rejectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 106</bibl></cit>: stridor adaugescit scopulorum saepe repulsu, <hi rend="ital">reechoing</hi>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 7, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsus raucos umbonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the striking together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durioris materiae,</quote> <trans><tr>resistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repumicatio: <entryFree id="n41276" type="hapax" key="re^pu_mi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pūmĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n41276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [pumico], <hi rend="ital">a making smooth again; a smoothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polishing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repumicatio et quaedam politura gemmarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a trimming off of the buds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 39, § 246</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repungo: <entryFree id="n41277" type="hapax" key="re^pungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpungo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">goad again;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter illorum animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repurgium: <entryFree id="n41278" type="main" key="re^purgi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpurgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>repurgo</etym>, <sense id="n41278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleansing again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cleaning out</hi> (late Lat.): formarum (aquaeductuum), Cod. Th. 15, 2, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 42, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repurgo: <entryFree id="n41279" type="main" key="re^purgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-purgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41279.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleanse</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">clear again</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveum Tiberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergastula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os, mox dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 37, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 38, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 15, 46, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum, Ov. de Nuce, 125: hortum repurgare steriles herbas eligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repurgato fugiebant nubila caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenitas caeli non recipit majorem claritatem in sincerissimum nitorem repurgata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:46" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 46</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41279.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to purge away; to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, for the sake of cleaning: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid in Aeneā fuerat mortale repurgat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reputatio: <entryFree id="n41280" type="main" key="re^pu^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpŭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reputo</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n41280.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A reckoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">computation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:48" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 48</bibl>. <cb n="REQU" /> —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:2:2" default="NO">27, 2, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41280.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A thinking over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pondering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio, consideratio): sed me veterum novorumque morum reputatio longius tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 3, 7, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:70:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 70, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">corresp. to contemplatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reputesco: <entryFree id="n41281" type="hapax" key="re^pu_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pūtesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become stinking again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reputo: <entryFree id="n41282" type="main" key="re^pu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pŭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to count over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calculate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compute</hi> (syn.: numero, expendo). </sense><sense id="n41282.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">solis defectiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos infantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus litis et viatica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 27, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vir) reputaturus patri, quod eo nomine praestiterit,</quote> <trans><tr>to charge in account</tr>, <tr>charge to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41282.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41282.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi> (freq. and class.; a favorite word of Sall. and Tac.; not used by Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: cogito, delibero): non reputat laboris quid sit, Nec, aequom anne iniquom imperet, cogitabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ille reputans et dies noctesque cogitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis quam id reputo, tam magis uror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: humanae vitae varia reputantes mala, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim Romanam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 21</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsus secum eam rem reputavit viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum haec mecum reputo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus suum cum animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:70:5" default="NO" valid="yes">70, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:85:10" default="NO" valid="yes">85, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc animo reputet, nostras nunc manus intueri senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animo reputare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev.
