Chron. 1, 24, 7</bibl></cit>; v. also in the foll.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibi nihil merito accidisse reputabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 51</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te moneo, hoc etiam atque etiam ut reputes, quid facere expetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ille vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum secum ipse reputaret, quam gravis casus in servitium ex regno foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde reputaret cum animo suo, praemia an cruciatum mallet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 70:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 70, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 85:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 10</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere reputantibus Galliam suismet viribus concidisse,</quote> <trans><tr>if we consider it rightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41282.4" n="B" level="2"> (Late Lat.) <hi rend="ital">To impute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui nec bona opera nec mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reputaturus patri, quod eo nomine praestiterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et reputatum est ei ad justitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
requies: <entryFree id="n41283" type="main" key="re^qui^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-quĭes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype> (<sense id="n41283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> requieï, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Parad. 3, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 704</bibl> P., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:II. p. 1460" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> II. p. 1460</bibl> ib.: requie, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 781</bibl> ib., or <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 97</bibl> Dietsch), <gen>f.</gen>, qs. <hi rend="ital">after-rest</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi> from labor, suffering, care, etc.; <hi rend="ital">relaxation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recreation</hi> (freq. and class.; not in Cæs.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">otium, quies): nec requies erat ulla mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requies curarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requies plena oblectationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mora, nec requies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 458</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 553</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 482</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">requies pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae requies medicina mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:118" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:295" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec requies (est), quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:602" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 602</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 227</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tantum requietis habeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervalla requietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> requietem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 52</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">requiem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 224</bibl></cit> (with otium); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 61, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 433</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 241</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 541</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 628</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:39:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 30, 12</bibl>; Luccei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 1</bibl> B. and K.— <hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">requies (hominum, Calliope),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 94</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> requiete, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 13, 22: <cit><quote lang="la">requiē,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 317</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 89</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Dat. sing.</hi> and the <number>plur.</number> do not occur.— </sense><sense id="n41283.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., = quies, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mora nec requies inter datur ulla fluendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:934" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 934</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc nimirum requies data principiorum Corporibus nulla est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:991" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 991</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requie sine ullā Corpora vertuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 214</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41283.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place of rest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic locus urbis erit, requies ea certa laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 393</bibl></cit>. <cb n="REQU" /></sense></entryFree>
requiesco: <entryFree id="n41284" type="main" key="re^qui^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-quĭesco</orth>, <itype>ēvi, ētum, 3</itype> (sync. requierant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:84:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 84, 7</bibl>: <sense id="n41284.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">requierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 22</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41284.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rest one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n41284.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones invicem requiescere atque in castra reverti jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 98 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in ejus sellā requiesceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostris sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:43" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:556 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 556 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā Sabaeā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:480" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno molli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam partem noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc noctem mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longas noctes tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:6:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminas Arctos Alcmenae,</quote> <trans><tr>rested two nights for the sake of Alcmena</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit> (3, 15), 25: <cit><quote lang="la">requiescens a rei publicae pulcherrimis muneribus ... requiescendi studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a turbā rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis ille suā lassus requiescat avenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:32:75" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 32, 75</bibl></cit>. — In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: paululum requietis militibus, <hi rend="ital">having rested themselves</hi>, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 8, 4</bibl>; v. under <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n41284.3" n="b" level="4"> Of things (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">luce sacrā requiescat humus, requiescat arator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:84:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 84, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures a strepitu hostili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis in vacua harenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 20), 7: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis in ulmo,</quote> <trans><tr>rests</tr>, <tr>supports itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 665</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot sideribus caelum requievit in illo (Atlante),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:661" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix dum requiescit amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiescit labor ille, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus lectione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora requierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:514" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 514</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41284.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of the dead, <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi> in the grave: ubi (sc. in sepulcro) remissa humana vita corpus requiescat malis. Vides quanto haec (sc. verba Ennii) in errore versentur; <cit><quote lang="la">portum esse corporis et requiescere in sepulcro putat mortuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:94:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 94, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa quieta, precor, tutā requiescite in urnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 14, 13</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Freq. in epitaphs: hic requiescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 71, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:18:1 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 18, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">REQVIESCIT IN PACE D(omini),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 962</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41284.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to repose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take consolation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi animus ex multis miseriis atque periculis requievit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis fatigatur auditor et requiescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alicujus Caesaris sermone, quasi in aliquo peropportuno deversorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spe alicujus requiescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiescendum in hac lectione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: nisi eorum exitio non requieturam, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 886</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41284.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let rest; to stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrest</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and mostly with a homogeneous object): sol quoque perpetuos meminit requiescere cursus, Calvus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutata suos requierunt flumina cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cir. 232</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕquĭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (not ante - Aug.). </sense><sense id="n41284.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rested</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refreshed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem requietum, integrum (opp. itinere fatigatum et onere fessum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum requietis militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">requietis et ordinatis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:5:25" default="NO">2, 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that has lain fallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 351</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra requietior et junior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41284.8" n="2" level="3"> In econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">that has lain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">been kept for a long time</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that is not fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
requietio: <entryFree id="n41285" type="main" key="re^qui^e_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕquĭētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>requiesco</etym>, <sense id="n41285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rest</hi> (late Lat.): septimo requietionis anno, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the Sabbatical year</hi>, Jov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jov. 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sabbatum enim requietionis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 16, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 7, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
requietorium: <entryFree id="n41286" type="gloss" key="re^qui^e_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕquĭētōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> I. A. 2</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n41286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a resting-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sepulchre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requietory</hi>, Inscr. Oreli. 4533.</sense></entryFree>
requietus: <entryFree id="n41287" type="main" key="re^qui^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕquĭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of requiesco.</entryFree>
requirito: <entryFree id="n41288" type="hapax" key="re^qui_ri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕquīrĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ask after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire for</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">res novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
requiro: <entryFree id="n41289" type="main" key="re^qui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-quīro</orth>, <itype>sīvi or sii, sītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quaero</etym>, <sense id="n41289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seek again; to look after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seek</hi> or <hi rend="ital">search for; to seek to know</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquire after</hi> (class.; cf.: repeto, reposco, exploro). </sense><sense id="n41289.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quid quaeritas? <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Vestigium hic requiro, Qua, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4</bibl>. 2, 58: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illam requiram jam, ubi ubi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 56</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4</bibl>, <pb n="1575" /> <cb n="REQU" /> 6, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 1</bibl>: legatos Allobrogum, Greg. M. in Job, 31, 54; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem oculisque animoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerva requisita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:22:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta SCtis abolita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extractum anulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus, ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus Velinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum generosum et lene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi neque admirantur neque requirunt rationes earum rerum, quas semper vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam tam facilis eventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea facta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M 13, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam requisita se occultant, et eadem forte succurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § 30 Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si quis parum credat, apud ipsum (Lucilium) in nono requirat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dependent clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">requireres, rogitares, quis esset, aut unde esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bestiae) ut requirant atque appetant, ad quas se applicent ejusdem generis animantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quoque requisivi, quā ratione, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 29, 88</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:22:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 22, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">requirunt, num aliquid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan et, Priami fuerint quae fata, requiras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum requisisset ubinam esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secum, cur sit bis rapta, requirit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 233</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiretur fortasse nunc, quemadmodem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmusne, ut pueri ... pulsi requirant et aliquid scire se gaudeant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito res vetustas reddere se et offerre, nec tantum requirentibus, sed etiam sponte interim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pande requirenti nomen terraeque tuumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 679</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41289.2" n="b" level="4"> Requirere ex or ab aliquo (aliquid), <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire any thing of a person; to question a person about any thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus requiram, quonam modo latuerint aut ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis requirit cur Romae non sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 40, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ex me requiris, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam nihil ex te hi requirunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:38:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 38, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilia sunt ea, quae a me de Vatinio requiris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut id a me neve in hoc reo neve in aliis requiras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud mihi numquam in mentem venit a te requirere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de antiquitate ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 20, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41289.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with the accessory idea of need, <hi rend="ital">to ask for</hi> something needed; <hi rend="ital">to need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in want of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi> (syn. desidero): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes hoc loco cives Romani vestram severitatem desiderant, vestram fidem implorant, vestrum auxilium requirunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui beatus est, non intellego, quid requirat, ut sit beatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit, non habet: desiderat, requirit, indiget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 87</bibl></cit>: isto bono utare, dum assit; <cit><quote lang="la">cum absit, ne requiras: nisi forte adulescentes pueritiam, paulum aetate progressi adulescentiam debent requirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam res diligentiam requirebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex liberis populis reges requiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala causa est quae requirit misericordiam, Publ. Syr. v. 312 Rib.: divitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41289.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be required</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be requisite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necessary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc bello Asiatico virtutes animi magnae et multae requiruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in altercatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquae orationes ad cognoscendam litium rationem requiruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41289.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like desiderare, <hi rend="ital">to perceive to be wanting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look in vain for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to miss</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (oculi) quocumque inciderunt, veterem consuetudinem fori et pristinum morem judiciorum requirunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:38:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 38, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pacis ornamenta et subsidia belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: unum <foreign lang="greek">i(storiko/n,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris in se indulgentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nonnumquam requirimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos, Quos quondam vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, ne desideres officium meum ... sed tamen vereor, ne litterarum a me officium requiras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo equidem majorum nostrorum saepe requiro prudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="RES" /> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕquīsītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">a want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requirement</hi> (rare): ad requisita naturae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to the calls</hi>, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 59</bibl> (Hist. 1, 54 Dietsch); <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Car. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
requisitio: <entryFree id="n41290" type="hapax" key="re^qui_si_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕquīsītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>requiro</etym>, <sense id="n41290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiae antiquioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
requisitum: <entryFree id="n41291" type="main" key="re^qui_si_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕquīsītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. requiro <sense id="n41291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
requisitus: <entryFree id="n41292" type="main" key="re^qui_si_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕquīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of requiro.</entryFree>
res: <entryFree id="n41293" type="main" key="re_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēs</orth>, <itype>rei</itype> (rēi with e long; <sense id="n41293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:548" default="NO" valid="yes">548</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:918" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 918</bibl>; <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 688</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 236</bibl>; rei, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, monosyl. at the end of the verse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:918" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 918</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the middle of the verse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:885" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 885</bibl></cit>, and Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 6</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym> etym. dub.; perh. root ra- of reor, ratus; cf. Germ. Ding; Engl. thing, from denken, to think; prop., that which is thought of; cf. also <foreign lang="greek">lo/gos,</foreign> Lid. and Scott, 9</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">being; a matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">event</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumstance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occurrence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">case</hi>, etc.; and sometimes merely = <hi rend="ital">something</hi> (cf.: causa, ratio, negotium). </sense><sense id="n41293.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">unde initum primum capiat res quaeque movendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 383</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 536</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in partes res quaeque minutas Distrahitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 826</bibl></cit>: summe Sol, qui omnes res inspicis, Enn. ap. Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl> (Trag. v. 321 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">versus, quos ego de Rerum Naturā pangere conor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum natura creatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinarum humanarumque rerum, tum initiorum causarumque cujusque rei cognitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit> (v. divinus): <cit><quote lang="la">haeret haec res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto, ut loquor, ita res est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud mentior, resque uti facta dico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Alcumenā ut rem teneatis rectius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 110: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantis rebus (sc. in re publicā defendendā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo Averna vocantur nomine, id ab re Impositum est, quia sunt avibus contraria cunctis,</quote> <trans><tr>from the nature of the thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 740</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 424</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res postulabit,</quote> <trans><tr>the condition of the case</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: scaena rei totius haec, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam in se nemo convertitur Nec recedit loco, quin statim rem gerat,</quote> <trans><tr>does his duty</tr>, <tr>stands his ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>; so, res gerere, v. gero; hence, too, rerum scriptor, for <hi rend="ital">a historian</hi>, v. scriptor, and cf. II. H. infra.—</sense><sense id="n41293.2" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">adj. of quality</hi>, to express condition, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">illic homo a me sibi malam rem arcessit,</quote> <trans><tr>is bringing a bad business on himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 171</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res mala,</quote> <trans><tr>a wretched condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 13</bibl></cit>; and more freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis tuis rebus meas res irrides malas,</quote> <trans><tr>circumstances</tr>, <tr>condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res secundae,</quote> <trans><tr>good fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res prosperae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in secundissimis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversae res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 136</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res belli adversae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res dubiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 30</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. bonus, florens, salvus, adversus, dubius, novus, arduus, etc.— Freq. in curses, etc.: in malam rem,</quote> <trans><tr>go to the bad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malam rem hinc ibis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41293.3" n="C" level="2"> With an <pos>adj.</pos> in a periphrasis: <cit><quote lang="la">abhorrens ab re uxoriā,</quote> <trans><tr>matrimony</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arbitrio rei uxoriae,</quote> <trans><tr>dowry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem divinam nisi compitalibus ... ne faciat,</quote> <trans><tr>a religious act</tr>, <tr>act of worship</tr>, <tr>a sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicam rem administrari majores nostri nisi auspicato noluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 36, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei pecuaria res ampla et rustica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: res rustica, <hi rend="ital">agriculture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei rusticae libro primo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">19: liber, quem de rebus rusticis scripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navalis rei certamina,</quote> <trans><tr>naval battles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei militaris gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res frumentaria,</quote> <trans><tr>forage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatae rei scientissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritus aquariae rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res judicaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ludicra,</quote> <trans><tr>play</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti rebus veneriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 431</bibl>; v. also familiaris, judiciaria, militaris, navalis, etc., and cf. II. G. infra. — </sense><sense id="n41293.4" n="D" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">pronouns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adjectives</hi>, as an emphatic periphrase for the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi me inclamat Alcumena: jam ea res me horrore afficit,</quote> <trans><tr>this now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Estne hoc, <cb n="RES" /> ut dico? <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Rectam instas viam: <cit><quote lang="la">Ea res est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is even so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fratre confido ita esse ut semper volui. Multa signa sunt ejus rei,</quote> <trans><tr>of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: quos (<foreign lang="greek">melittw=nas</foreign>) alii <foreign lang="greek">melittotrofei=a</foreign> appellant, eandem rem quidam mellaria. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt ex te quae scitari volo, Quarum rerum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus de rebus quoniam nobis contigit ut aliquid essemus consecuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā super re interfectum esse Hippotem dixisti? Pac. ap. Fest. s. v. superescit, p. 244: resciscet Amphitruo rem omnem,</quote> <trans><tr>every thing</tr>, <tr>all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla res tam delirantes homines concinat cito,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est ulla res, in quā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 9</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: sumptu ne parcas ullā in re, quod ad valetudinem opus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna res principio statim bello,</quote> <trans><tr>a great thing</tr>, <tr>a great advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil admirari prope res est una Solaque, quae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the only thing</tr>, <tr>only means</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit> et saep. — Emphatically with <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet rerum facta est pulcherrima Roma,</quote> <trans><tr>the most beautiful thing in the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 534</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 16</bibl> Spald. p. 81. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of persons, etc.: est genus hominum, qui esse primos se omnium rerum volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 107</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima rerum Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 602</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 508</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissima rerum animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:502" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcherrime rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcissime rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41293.5" n="E" level="2"> In adverb. phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">e re natā melius fieri haud potuit,</quote> <trans><tr>after what has happened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro re natā,</quote> <trans><tr>according to circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tempore et pro re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factis benignus pro re,</quote> <trans><tr>according to circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro re pauca loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 337</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1280</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex re et ex tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e re respondi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n41293.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41293.7" n="A" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">an actual thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the thing itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fact;</hi> opposed to appearance, mere talk, the mere name of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ecastor, re experior, quanti facias uxorem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiste dictis nunc jam miseram me consolari: Nisi quid re praesidium apparas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: rem ipsam loqui. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem fabulari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin 2, 4, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est aliud in re,</quote> <trans><tr>in fact</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsa res aperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex re decerpere fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 79</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. verbum, vox, opinio, spes, nomen, etc.: rem opinor spectari oportere, non verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: te rogo, ut rem potiorem oratione ducas, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo res omnes, sed etiam rumores cognoscamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hos deos non re, sed opinione esse dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Peripateticos et Academicos nominibus differentes, re congruentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nos honestum, illi vanum ... verbis quam re probabilius vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum, tametsi verbo non audeat, tamen re ipsā de maleficio suo confiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Rosc. Am. 42:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 42, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides quantum distet argumentatio tua ab re ipsā atque a veritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 44</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, often strengthened by verā (sometimes as one word, reverā), <hi rend="ital">in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">really</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in reality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ille, si verbis non audet, re quidem verā palam loquitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 17, 56</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">re quidem verā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">re autem verā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply re verā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:54:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 54, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">re verāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et re verā,</quote> <trans><tr>indeed</tr>, <tr>in fact</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:19" default="NO">4, 16, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 13</bibl>, ext. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:10" default="NO">12, 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41293.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Effects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Chrysalus Perdidit filium, me atque rem omnem Meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Habuitne rem? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Habuit. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Qui eam perdidit ... Mercaturamne an venales habuit, ubi rem perdidit? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:49 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 49 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus et re salvā et perditā profueram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem talentum decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidior ad rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res eos jampridem, fides deficere nuper coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1576" /> <cb n="RES" /> 10: <cit><quote lang="la">qui duo patrimonia accepisset remque praeterea bonis et honestis rationibus auxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertino natum patre et in tenui re,</quote> <trans><tr>in narrow circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 20</bibl></cit> et saep.; v. also familiaris.— In <number>plur.</number>: quantis opibus, quibus de rebus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 396 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">privatae res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41293.9" n="2" level="3"> Hence, law t. t., <hi rend="ital">whatever may be the subject of a right</hi>, whether corporeal or incorporeal (v. Sandars, Introd. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. p. 42" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. p. 42</bibl> sqq.): <cit><quote lang="la">res corporales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:2:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 2, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in patrimonio, res extra patrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 1</bibl></cit> pr.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res sanctae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; v. also mancipium, privatus, etc.— </sense><sense id="n41293.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Benefit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res magis quaeritur, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius illi consulas quam rei tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tuā re feceris,</quote> <trans><tr>to your advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>.— Most freq. with the prepositions <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi istic minor mea res agatur quam tua,</quote> <trans><tr>is interested</tr>, <tr>affected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 113</bibl></cit> (v. ago): <cit><quote lang="la">si in rem tuam esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide si hoc in rem deputas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in rem recte conducat tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in remst utrique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi melius est, quid magis in rem est, quam? etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>useful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen in rem fore credens universos adpellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae in rem videbantur esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad conparanda ea quae in rem erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperat quae in rem sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 44, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tuā re non est, ut ego emoriar,</quote> <trans><tr>for your advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">An.</hi> Non pudet Vanitatis? <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Minime, dum ob rem, <hi rend="ital">to the purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with advantage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 41</bibl>: ob rem facere, <hi rend="ital">usefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with advantage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 5</bibl>: subdole blanditur, ab re Consulit blandiloquentulus, <hi rend="ital">contrary to his interest</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to his injury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 12</bibl> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">haud id est ab re aucupis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec haud ab re duxi referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ab re esse Quinctio visum est interesse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 32, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 35, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:4" default="NO">1, 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4, 19</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41293.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">account;</hi> only in the connection eā (hac) re, and eam ob rem, adverb., <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā re tot res sunt, ubi bene deicias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 158, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac re nequeunt ex omnibus omnia gigni, Quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 172</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud eā re a se esse concessum, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem exoravi, tibi ne noceat, neu quid ob eam rem succenseat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi rei?</quote> <trans><tr>for what purpose?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 3, 3</bibl>.—Hence (by uniting into one word) the causal adverbs quare and quamobrem, v. h. vv.— </sense><sense id="n41293.12" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An affair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matter of business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">business</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et de societate inter se multa communicarent et de totā illā ratione atque re Gallicanā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem cum aliquo transigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13, 39</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, transf., in gen.: res alicui est cum aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to have to do with any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 16, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">famigeratori res sit cum damno et malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 182</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.— Also without a <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam cum senatore res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp., in mal. part.: rem habere cum aliquo or aliquā,</quote> <trans><tr>to have to do with any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">58</bibl>. —Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam biennium est, quom mecum rem coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41293.13" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A case in law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lawsuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suit</hi> (more gen. than causa): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi res prolatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus res erat in controversiā, ea vocabatur lis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=93" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(prob. in allusion to this legal form): tot homines ... statuere non potuisse, utrum diem tertium an perendinum ... rem an litem dici oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quarum rerum litium causarum condixit pater patratus, etc., an ancient formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus ab aliquo cognitis judicatisque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:48:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 48, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias capere ob rem judicandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res certabitur olim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractu temporis futurum, ut res pereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:30:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: res judicata dicitur, quae finem controversiarum pronuntiatione<cb n="RESA" />  judicis accipit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 1, 1</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n41293.14" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An affair</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">campaign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">military operations;</hi> in phrase rem (or res) gerere: <cit><quote lang="la">res gesta virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut res gesta est ordine narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus gestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem bene gerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comminus rem gerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 251</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus duos simul rem gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem male gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in relatione rerum ab Scythis gestarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante rem,</quote> <trans><tr>before the battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Thebanis sibi rem esse existimant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 37</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41293.15" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Acts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">events</hi>, as the subject of narration, <hi rend="ital">a story</hi>, <hi rend="ital">history</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in unam sententiam scripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui lecta potenter erit res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A.
