P. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medias res auditorem rapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitur res in scaenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 179</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numeros animosque secutus, non res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut in rebus ejus (Neronis) exposuimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 83, 85, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae, quibus non modo res omnis, sed etiam rumores cognoscamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res populi Romani perscribere, Liv. praef. § 1: res Persicae,</quote> <trans><tr>history</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41293.16" n="K" level="1"> Res publica, also as one word, respublica, <hi rend="ital">the common weal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a commonwealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">republic</hi> (cf. civitas); also, <hi rend="ital">civil affairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administration</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, etc.: qui pro republicā, non pro suā obsonat, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 18, p. 210</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erat tuae virtutis, in minimis tuas res ponere, de re publicā vehementius laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dummodo ista privata sit calamitas et a rei publicae periculis sejungatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si re publicā non possis frui, stultum est nolle privatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestates tot egentissimorum hominum nec privatas posse res nec rem publicam sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 5</bibl></cit> (v. publicus); Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:14:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 14, 3</bibl>: auguratum est, rem Romanam publicam summam fore, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo utiliores rebus suis publicis essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commutata ratio est rei totius publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: pro republicā niti, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">merere de republicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publicā disputatio . . . dubitationem ad rem publicam adeundi tollere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnare rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:23:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 23, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene victā re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delere rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 15, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18, 28</bibl>.—Esp. in the phrase e re publicā, <hi rend="ital">for the good of the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the public benefit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs consultis bene et e re publicā factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea si dicam non esse e re publicā dividi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 34, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—Post-class. and rare, also ex republicā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:3:47" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:9:1" default="NO">11, 9, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but exque is used for euphony (class.): id eum recte atque ordine exque re publicā fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 15, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 11, 26</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae nationes respublicas suas amiserunt, C. Gracch. ap. Fest. s. h. v. p. 286 Müll.: hoc loquor de tribus his generibus rerum publicarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuitus in rebus publicis commutationum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 45</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n41293.17" n="2" level="3"> Sometimes simply res, <hi rend="ital">the State</hi> (in the poets, and since the Aug. per. in prose): unus homo nobis cunctando restituit rem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl> (Ann. v. 313 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Marcellus) rem Romanam sistet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 858</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec rem Romanam tam desidem umquam fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva ista non contemnendo majores nostri maximam hanc rem fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:66" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 809</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut paulo ante animum inter Fidenatem Romanamque rem ancipitem gessisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Asiae evertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custode rerum Caesare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res sine discordiā translatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; so (also in Cic.), rerum potiri, v. potior. — </sense><sense id="n41293.18" n="L" level="1"> Res novae, <hi rend="ital">political changes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a revolution</hi>, etc.; v. novus.</sense></entryFree>
resacro: <entryFree id="n41294" type="main" key="re^sa^cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsăcro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. resecro.</entryFree>
resaevio: <entryFree id="n41295" type="hapax" key="re^saevi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-saevĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rage again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resalutatio: <entryFree id="n41296" type="hapax" key="re^sa^lu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsălūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resaluto</etym>, <sense id="n41296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="RESC" /> <hi rend="ital">greeting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">salutation in return</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
resaluto: <entryFree id="n41297" type="main" key="re^sa^lu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sălūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to greet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">salute in return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return a salutation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:21:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:57:2" default="NO">5, 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:70:5" default="NO">10, 70, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:43:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 43, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resalvare: <entryFree id="n41298" type="main" key="re^salva_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-salvāre</orth>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to save again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redeem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam suam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 98, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: resalvati ex monte Zion, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 31, 1.</sense></entryFree>
resanesco: <entryFree id="n41299" type="main" key="re^sa_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sānesco</orth>, <itype>nŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n41299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow sound again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heal again;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">error animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resano: <entryFree id="n41300" type="main" key="re^sa_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sāno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make sound again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heal again</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: impios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">phreneticos symphonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 926</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, § 224</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resarcio: <entryFree id="n41301" type="main" key="re^sarci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sarcĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n41301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sartum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to patch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mend again; to repair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> (rare; not in Cic.; cf. sarcio). </sense><sense id="n41301.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">discidit vestem? resarcietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fracta juga vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to fill up again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41301.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. compenso): <cit><quote lang="la">si quid esset in bello detrimenti acceptum, id brevi tempore resarciri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: ut et jacturam capitis amissi restituat et quaestum resarciat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum liberalitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resarrio: <entryFree id="n41302" type="hapax" key="re^sarri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sarrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hoe again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 183</bibl></cit> (Jahn, reseverunt).</sense></entryFree>
rescindo: <entryFree id="n41303" type="main" key="re_scindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-scindo</orth>, <itype>scĭdi, scissum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">break down; to cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear open</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n41303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to break down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 19</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 6, 29; 7, 35; 7, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum ac loricam falcibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: pluteos, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cameras tectorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:4:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta domusque in usum novae classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 280</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 583</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuem vestem e membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ense teli latebram penitus,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:23:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 19, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:507" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescisso palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:72" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venam,</quote> <trans><tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:2" default="NO">7, 10, 2</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">obductos annis luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an male sarta Gratia nequidquam coit et rescinditur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Petronius: ne inter initia coëuntis gratiae recentem cicatricem rescinderet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41303.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2,406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum praesidiis firmatum atque omni ratione obvallatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro summum Ulceris os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 453</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latentia vitia (corresp. to aperire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41303.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrogate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rescind</hi> a law, decree, agreement, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi non videtur, quod sit factum legibus, Rescindi posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta M. Antonii rescidistis, leges refixistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">acta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42, 109</bibl></cit>; 13, 3, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:23:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta deūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 784</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:678" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitutiones senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilia habita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam triennii praeturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:57:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 57, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescindere et irritas facere omnes istius injurias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">63: res judicatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 22, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitiosas Centumvir. sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenta mortuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:43:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 43, § 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus turpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:90:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 90, 3</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevi leges validas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium suum insequenti injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 7, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rescio: <entryFree id="n41304" type="main" key="re_sci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēscĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. rescisco <sense id="n41304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rescisco: <entryFree id="n41305" type="main" key="re_scisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-scisco</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 3</itype> (the primitive form, rescio, is assumed by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:19:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 19, 4</bibl>, but is not confirmed by any example), <sense id="n41305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to learn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascertain</hi> a thing (qs. bringing it again to light from concealment; cf. reperio; mostly ante-class.; esp. freq. in Ter.). </sense><sense id="n41305.1" n="1" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">tempp. press.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia omnes ubi resciscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 27 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 28</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 26</bibl>; <pb n="1577" /> <cb n="RESC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 19</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41305.2" n="2" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi>: ea Lucani ubi resciverunt, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:19:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 19, 7</bibl>; Naev. and Cato ap. Gell. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 12</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 5</bibl>: cum id rescierit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 424</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resciit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescitum iri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rescissio: <entryFree id="n41306" type="main" key="re_scissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēscissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> [rescindo, II.), <sense id="n41306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annulling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rescinding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rescission</hi> (in jurid. and eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n41306.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prioris decreti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:9:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:24:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 24, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emancipationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:4:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41306.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 57, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rescissorius: <entryFree id="n41307" type="main" key="resci_sso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rescīssōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.; cf. rescissio</etym>; in jurid. Lat., <sense id="n41307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to abrogating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revoking</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rescinding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rescissory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rescissōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = rescissoria actio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 5, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rescissus: <entryFree id="n41308" type="main" key="rescissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rescissus</orth>,, a, um, <mood>Part.</mood> of rescindo.</entryFree>
rescribo: <entryFree id="n41309" type="main" key="re_scri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41309.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To write back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reply in writing</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n41309.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">antemeridianis tuis litteris heri statim rescripsi: nunc respondeo vespertinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cui rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; 13, 21, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae mihi redditae sunt a Pompeio . . . ei statim rescripsi, non me quaerere, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam (epistulam) rescribam igitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea, quae requisieras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi ad ea quae quaeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Trebatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius rescripserat, sese, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi meam (epistulam), quam ad eum rescripseram, misi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debes hoc etiam rescribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: rescribere veteribus orationibus, <hi rend="ital">to write against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply to</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)ntigra/fein,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 20</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">orationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum actionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus libris de Orthographiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rescripta Bruto de Catone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil mihi rescribas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non rescribendi gloria visa levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:17:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 3</bibl>, descriptos is the true read.).—</sense><sense id="n41309.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41309.3" n="1" level="3"> Polit. and jurid. t. t., of emperors or lawyers, <hi rend="ital">to answer in writing</hi> a petition or legal question; <hi rend="ital">to give a rescript</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a judicial decision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberio pro cliente Graeco petenti rescripsit (Augustus), non aliter se daturum quam si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:71 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 1, 71 al.</bibl>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēscriptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an imperial rescript</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 15</bibl> (9): <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitum est, an adversus rescriptum principis provocari possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod et Herennio Modestino studioso meo de Dalmatiā consulenti rescripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:53:section=20" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 2, 53, § 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:46" default="NO">40, 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:29 al" default="NO">40, 7, 29 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n41309.4" n="2" level="3"> In account-books, <hi rend="ital">to make an entry</hi> per contra; <hi rend="ital">to place to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s credit;</hi> hence, i. q. <hi rend="ital">to pay back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud mihi Argentum rursum jube rescribi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de residuis CCCC. HS. CC. praesentia solverimus, reliqua rescribamus,</quote> <trans><tr>will place to his credit</tr>, <tr>will pay hereafter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictantis, quod tu numquam rescribere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Darios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41309.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To write over again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write anew</hi> (not anteAug.): Pollio Asinius parum diligenter compositos putat (Caesaris commentarios), existimatque rescripturum et correcturum fuisse, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to revise</hi> (syn. retractare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 5</bibl>; 8, 21, 6.—</sense><sense id="n41309.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to enroll anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to re-enlist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescriptae ex eodem milite novae legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41309.7" n="3" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to transfer</hi> from one kind of troops to another: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem decimam legionem ad equum rescribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
rescriptio: <entryFree id="n41310" type="main" key="re_scripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rescribo, I. B. 1.</etym>; <sense id="n41310.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in jurid. Lat. for rescriptum,</quote> <trans><tr>an imperial rescript</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:8 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 18, 8 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
rescriptum: <entryFree id="n41311" type="main" key="re_scriptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēscriptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. rescribo, I. B. 1.</entryFree>
rescriptus: <entryFree id="n41312" type="main" key="re_scriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēscriptus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <mood>Part.</mood> of rescribo.</entryFree>
resculpo: <entryFree id="n41313" type="main" key="re_sculpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-sculpo</orth>, <itype>psi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carve</hi> or <hi rend="ital">form again;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi> (eccl. <cb n="RESE" /> Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 5</bibl></cit>: lineam, Prud. Psych. praef. 51.</sense></entryFree>
resecabilis: <entryFree id="n41314" type="main" key="re^se^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĕcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reseco</etym>, <sense id="n41314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit to be cut away</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfidiae excessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resecatio: <entryFree id="n41315" type="main" key="re^se^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĕcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting off</hi> (late Lat.); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: peccatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reseco: <entryFree id="n41316" type="main" key="re^se^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sĕco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum</itype> (resecavi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:73" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 73</bibl>: <sense id="n41316.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">resecata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Grat. Act. ad Const. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to cut loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi> (class.; esp. in the trop. signif.; cf. praecido). </sense><sense id="n41316.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut linguae scalpello resectae liberarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enodes truncos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longos ferro capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:182" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tergore partem Exiguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:650" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba resecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremam partem ipsius unguis ad vivum,</quote> <trans><tr>to the quick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:15" default="NO">5, 9, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41316.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curtail; to check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aiunt, nimia resecari oportere, naturalia relinqui (shortly after, circumcidere and amputare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:26:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 26, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae resecanda erunt, non patiar ad perniciem civitatis manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacias et libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89:section=208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89, § 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina quaedam cum primā barbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatio brevi Spem longam reseces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (dicta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id ad vivum reseco, ut illi qui haec subtilius disserunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>nor do I take this in too strict a sense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl></cit> (v. supra, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">de vivo aliquid erat resecandum,</quote> <trans><tr>was to be cut from the quick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resecro: <entryFree id="n41317" type="main" key="re^se_^cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sē^cro</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">re-sacro</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41317.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pray</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beseech again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to implore repeatedly</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">resecroque, mater, quod dudum, obsecraveram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">with obsecro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41317.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To free from a curse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eumolpidae sacerdotes rursus resacrare sunt coacti, qui eum devoverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. pp. 280 and 281 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
resectio: <entryFree id="n41318" type="main" key="re^secti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reseco</etym>, <sense id="n41318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trimming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruning</hi> of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:4" default="NO">4, 32, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:16" default="NO">4, 24, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resectus: <entryFree id="n41319" type="main" key="re^sectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of reseco.</entryFree>
resecutus: <entryFree id="n41320" type="main" key="re^se^cu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĕcūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. resequor.</entryFree>
reseda: <entryFree id="n41321" type="main" key="re^se_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsēda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>: Reseda alba, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 106, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resedo: <entryFree id="n41322" type="main" key="re^se_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sēdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to assuage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heal</hi> (very rare); with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 106, § 131</bibl></cit> (the words of a charm).</sense></entryFree>
resegmina: <entryFree id="n41323" type="main" key="re^segmi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsegmĭna</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>reseco</etym>, <sense id="n41323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clippings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papyri amputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resemino: <entryFree id="n41324" type="hapax" key="re^se_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sēmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow again;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to beget</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produce again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (phoenix),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 392</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resequor: <entryFree id="n41325" type="main" key="re^se^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sĕquor</orth>, <itype>sĕcūtus, 3</itype> (occurring only in the <sense id="n41325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> in speaking, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply to</hi> one (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Nereïs his contra resecuta Crataeide natam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallada talibus dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogantem his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:863" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 863</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of an echo: solatur nostras Echo resecuta querelas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 25, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitum querelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 99, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reserabilis: <entryFree id="n41326" type="main" key="re^se^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. resero</etym>, <sense id="n41326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">able to unlock</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reseratus: <entryFree id="n41327" type="hapax" key="re^se^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĕrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unlocking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluminis ipsius operisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resero: <entryFree id="n41328" type="main" key="re^se^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sēvi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant again; to plant</hi> with any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 39</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:2" default="NO">3, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41329" type="main" key="re^se^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>3. sero</etym>, <sense id="n41329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unlock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> (syn.: recludo, pando, aperio; class.; esp. freq. after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n41329.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi domos suas claudunt aut reserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:60" default="NO">1, 8, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 384</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:761" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 761</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:455" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">portas hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:334" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam exteris gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. also Italiam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> ex conj.): <cit><quote lang="la">urbem reserare et pandere portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infernas sedes (with recludere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 663</bibl></cit>: <cb n="RESE" /> latebras insidiarum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <trans><tr>to take by storm</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 8, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulac species patefacta est verna diei Et reserata viget genetabilis aura Favoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41329.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41329.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclose</hi>: nos ausi reserare . . . , Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 171</bibl> (Ann. v. 226 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec ita claudenda res est familiaris, ut eam benignitas aperire non possit, nec ita reseranda, ut pateat omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsaepta diutinā servitute ora reseramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi, Jane biceps, longum reseraveris annum,</quote> <trans><tr>open</tr>, <tr>begin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aperire annum fastosque reserare (as consul),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:58:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 58, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emicuit reserata dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:655" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 655</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41329.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi> something unknown: <cit><quote lang="la">oracula mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:438" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:436" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operta animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Julian. 17</bibl></cit>: commissa, Petr. poët. Fragm. 28, 6.</sense></entryFree>
reservo: <entryFree id="n41330" type="main" key="re^servo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-servo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">save up</hi>, qs. for future use; <hi rend="ital">to reserve</hi> (very freq. and class.; cf. repono); constr.: <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>) <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, with a terminal <pos>adv.</pos> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41330.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas merces commeatusque ad obsidionem urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum libros sibi ad Tusculani requiem atque otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 224</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam suam ad incertissimam spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc consilium ad extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ejus periculum legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem non ad vitam suam sed ad salutem vestram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ad aliquod severius judicium, id. Or. in Tog. Cand. (tom. ii. 1, p. 523 Orell.): vos ad eam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testem ad extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne et hominem ipsum ad dubia rei publicae tempora reservandum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 19, 42</bibl></cit>(15, 32): <cit><quote lang="la">utinam ad illa tempora me fortuna reservavisset!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad majora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 368</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41330.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiasque in aliud tempus reservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas praesentis fraudis in diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem (stercoris) in pratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in aliud tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos in unum pugnae laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41330.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura reservans semina rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illorum esse praedam atque illis reservari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam a judicibus praetermissam ipsis (decemviris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiam rei mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi se peritura Pergama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera praesenti sermoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista judicia melioribus meis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se temporibus aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me Minucio et Salvio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te non urbi sed carceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui te exitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolumem Pallanta mihi si fata reservant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se judiciis posterorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:121" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 121</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n41330.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With a terminal <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc homine facias? aut quo civem importunum reserves?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 13, 29</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With a simple object, <hi rend="ital">to keep from perishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to save</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vide ne, cum velis revocare tempus omnium reservandorum, cum qui servetur non erit, non possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partum reservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reservatis Haeduis atque Arvernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 89 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitique tenax et qui quaesita reservent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 657</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reses: <entryFree id="n41331" type="main" key="re^se^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<sense id="n41331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> does not occur), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>resideo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that remains sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that stays behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that remains;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">motionless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unoccupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lazy</hi>, etc. (syn.: segnis, tardus, desidiosus; not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not found in Cic. or (Cæs.): reses ignavus, quia residet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=280" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 280</bibl> Müll.; cf. Pac. and Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=281" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 281</bibl> ib. (Trag. Rel. p. 66 Rib.; Com. Rel. p. 170 ib.); Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=213" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 213</bibl> Müll. dub.: aqua, <hi rend="ital">standing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stagnant water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <trans><tr>calm</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 86, 2</bibl></cit>: caseus in corpore, <hi rend="ital">undigested</hi> (opp. alibilis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 3</bibl>: plebs in urbe. <hi rend="ital">remaining</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem pugnantium crepitumque armorum exaudimus resides ipsi ac segnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6</bibl>, <pb n="1578" /> <cb n="RESI" /> 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:814" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 814</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 693</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">resides et desuetudine tardi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 436</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevertere amore Jam pridem resides animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 722</bibl></cit>: anni, <hi rend="ital">passed in inaction</hi>, Claud. B. Get. praef. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi,</quote> <trans><tr>long untouched</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. 15.</sense></entryFree>
resex: <entryFree id="n41332" type="main" key="re^sex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsex</orth>, <itype>ĕcis</itype> (only resecem and reseces occur), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reseco</etym>, <sense id="n41332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the stump of a vinebranch left in pruning</hi>, = pollex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:15" default="NO">3, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:17" default="NO">4, 24, 17</bibl>; 5, 5, 11.</sense></entryFree>
resibilo: <entryFree id="n41333" type="hapax" key="re^si_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sībĭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hiss at</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resideo: <entryFree id="n41334" type="main" key="re^si^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [sedeo], <hi rend="ital">to sit back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain sitting</hi> anywhere (cf. resisto); <hi rend="ital">to remain behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">linger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reside</hi> (syn. remaneo; class.). </sense><sense id="n41334.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine mente animoque nequit residere per artus pars ulla animai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piger pandi tergo residebat aselli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:749" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 124</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Acidis in gremio (latitans),</quote> <trans><tr>resting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:787" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 787</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc facto de cautibus antro,</quote> <trans><tr>residing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:575" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 575</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Erycina Monte suo residens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:364" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in villā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te interfici jussero, residebit in re publicā reliqua conjuratorum manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvus altā arbore residens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit> (but the correct read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 9</bibl>, is residamus; v. Madv. ad h. l.).— In <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydum patriis in terris resedisse, Tyrrheno datum novas ut conderet sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oppido aliquo mallem resedisse, quoad arcesserer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erravitne viā seu lassa resedit, Incertum,</quote> <trans><tr>remained behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 739</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fessus valle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassus in humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:3:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 3, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio rex ipse resedit Agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orba resedit Exanimes inter natos natasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:301" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxo resedit Pastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dorsum meum residebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 23</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41334.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sit up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume a sitting posture</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">et resedit qui erat mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 7, 15</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41334.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sit inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain idle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">listless</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">artifex cum exprimere vellet Athamantis furorem Learcho filio praecipitato residentis poenitentiā,</quote> <trans><tr>sitting listlessly subdued by remorse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 40, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles residet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 112</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">celebrate</hi> a holiday: <cit><quote lang="la">venter gutturque resident esuriales ferias (v. esurialis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero tam denicales (quae a nece appellatae sunt, quia residentur mortuis) quam ceterorum caelestium quieti dies Feriae nominarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>because they are kept in honor of the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 55</bibl></cit> Creuz (codd. leg. residentur mortui; B. and K. resident mortui; cf.I.supra).—</sense><sense id="n41334.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to remain behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be left</hi> (a favorite word with Cic.; syn.: resto, supersum); constr most freq., <hi rend="ital">in aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in corpore perspicuum est, vel exstincto animo vel elapso, nullum residere sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 104</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex tanto latrocinio iste unus tolletur, periculum residebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quas inimicitias residere in familiis nostris arbitretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl></cit>, B, § 4; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in vobis resident mores pristini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. prol. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ullas resedisse in te simultatis reliquias senserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid amoris erga me in te residet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam nunc residet spes in virtute tuā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum non in sententiā solum, sed etiam in nutu residebat auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum in consilio pristinae residere virtutis memoria videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum horum tectis et sedibus residere aliquod bellum semper videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 23, 61</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud me plus officii residere facile patior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus incommodi culpa ubi resideat, facilius possum existimare quam scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua (ira) ex certamine residet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 7</bibl></cit>. — Business t. t., <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remain behind</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be unaccounted for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in default</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia publica resedit apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:13:4:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 13, 4, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resido: <entryFree id="n41335" type="main" key="re^si_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sīdo</orth>, <itype>sēdi</itype> (in some MSS. also rĕsīdi), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sit down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to settle</hi> anywhere (class.). </sense><sense id="n41335.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">residamus, si placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ripă inambulantes, tum vero residentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aves)
