plurimum volant ... cetera genera residunt et insistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 39, 55, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediis residunt Aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculis arvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">residunt In partem, quae peste caret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 539</bibl></cit>: <cb n="RESI" /> loci amoenitate captos in iisdem terris cum virgine resedisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 7, 8</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam jam residunt cruribus asperae Pelles,</quote> <trans><tr>settle</tr>, <tr>gather</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 9</bibl></cit>. — In <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consessu exstructo resedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 290</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41335.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to settle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subside</hi> (cf. consido and decido): <cit><quote lang="la">si montes resedissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Nilus) residit iisdem quibus accrevit modis (opp. crescit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 272</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maria in se ipsa residant (opp. tumescant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 480</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">residentibus flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41335.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">settle down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum venti posuere omnisque repente resedit Flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex mihi surgat opus numeris (i. e. in the hexameter), m quinque residat (i. e. in the pentameter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit> (cf. Coleridge's "falling in melody back"): <cit><quote lang="la">(poëma) apte et varie nunc attollebatur, nunc residebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si contrarius ventus resedisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tumor animi resedisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: Marcelli impetus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus animorum ardorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed propera ne vela cadant auraeque residant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 643</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clandestinis nunciis Allobrogas sollicitat, quorum mentes nondum ab superiore bello resedisse sperabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:64:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 64, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longiore certamine sensim residere Samnitium animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardorem eum, qui resederat, excitare rursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumida ex ira corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 407</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
residuus: <entryFree id="n41336" type="main" key="re^si^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>resideo</etym>, <sense id="n41336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is left behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that remains over and above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">residuary; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the remainder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">residue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquus, superstes): odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: sollicitudo, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex residuā vetere simultate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen libertatis (with reliqua umbra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">residuae integraeque etiam nunc (copiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manus Spartaci et Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps horum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid potest esse in calamitate residui, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:97:section=226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 97, § 226</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui residui spiritus quicquam inesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">residui nobilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos comites residuos fortuna fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:2" default="NO">7, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">residuum cibariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil residuum crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">residua diurni actūs conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41336.1" n="b" level="4"> In business lang., of a payment, <hi rend="ital">outstanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">due</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 47</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">summae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 7, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid relatum, quid residuum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 59</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĭdŭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pecuniae), <hi rend="ital">arrears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dues</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege Juliā de residuis tenetur, qui publicam pecuniam delegatam in usum aliquem retinuit neque in eum consumpsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:13:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:13:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 13, 5</bibl> and 16.?*! In the fragment of Attius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=280" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 280</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 192 Rib.), perh. = reses, <hi rend="ital">slothfui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive;</hi> cf.: residuus quasi tardus, Placid. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
resignaculum: <entryFree id="n41337" type="hapax" key="re^signa_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsignācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>resigno</etym>, <sense id="n41337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unsealing;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a disclosure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resignatrix: <entryFree id="n41338" type="main" key="re^signa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsignātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resignator</etym>, <sense id="n41338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that unseals</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris Eva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resigno: <entryFree id="n41339" type="main" key="re^signo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-signo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41339.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To unseal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41339.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:6" default="NO">29, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 14, § 89</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuria Graia resignat,</quote> <trans><tr>breaks through the faithless band</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:426" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 426</bibl></cit>: (Mercurius) lumina morte resignat, <hi rend="ital">opens the eyes</hi> of the dead whom he is about to conduct to Orcus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 244</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41339.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41339.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invalidate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rescind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">rescindere, dissolvere): tabularum fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid ex constituti fide resignaret,</quote> <trans><tr>violate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit> Duker: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:790" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura leti (Mercurius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum mors resignata est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41339.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">venientia fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:535" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc, quod latet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:28" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>: verba,<cb n="RESI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:36:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 36, 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41339.5" n="II" level="1"> Ante-class. and in Hor. = rescribere (I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to transfer</hi> in an account; <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi> to one: <cit><quote lang="la">resignare antiqui dicebant pro rescribere, ut adhuc subsignare dicimus pro subscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=281:31" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 281, 31</bibl></cit> Müll.: resignatum aes dicitur militi, cum ob delictum aliquod jussu tribuni militum, ne stipendium ei detur, in tabulas refertur. Signare enim dicebant pro scribere, id. pp. 284 and 285 ib.; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 244</bibl>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">to give back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi>, = reddere: <cit><quote lang="la">laudo manentem (Fortunam): si celeres quatit Pennas, resigno quae dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta resigno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resilio: <entryFree id="n41340" type="main" key="re^si^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (resiliit, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 906</bibl> P.; <sense id="n41340.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">resilivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring back</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n41340.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(exit in terram) in Indiae fluminibus certum genus piscium, ac deinde resilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 19, 35, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recedere sensim datur (oratoribus): Quidam et resiliunt, quod est plane ridiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:127" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ranae) saepe In gelidos resilire lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piratae in aquas suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velites ad manipulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a taetro veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polypus ab odore cunilae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 70, 90, § 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:75" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 8, 19, § 75</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41340.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things as subjects, <hi rend="ital">to spring back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">start back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 347</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis ferit ora sarissā. Non secus haec resilit, quam tecti a culmine grando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis ab ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 54, 55, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cervices) ab imposito nuper jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resilire guttas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 15, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radii infracti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvae tactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 13, 15, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Taurus mons) resilit ad Septentriones,</quote> <trans><tr>retreats</tr>, <tr>recedes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spatium resilire manus breve vidit,</quote> <trans><tr>to shrink</tr>, <tr>contract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 677</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(mamma) detracto alumno suo sterilescit ilice ac resilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 234</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41340.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to recoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">start back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrink from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi scopulum offendis ejusmodi ut ab hoc crimen resilire videas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instandum iis, quae placere intellexeris, resiliendum ab iis, quae non recipientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut liceret resilire emptori, meliore conditione allatā,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw</tr>, <tr>recede</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resimplicatus: <entryFree id="n41341" type="hapax" key="re^simpli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-simplĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [simplico], <sense id="n41341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resimus: <entryFree id="n41342" type="main" key="re^si_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n41342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turned up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares (boum, simiarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum hippopotami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 39, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resina: <entryFree id="n41343" type="main" key="re_si_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">r(hti/nh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n41343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rosin</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 19, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:32" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 22, § 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:74:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 74, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:21" default="NO">12, 32, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum quod resinā conditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina terebintha,</quote> <trans><tr>turpentine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resinaceus: <entryFree id="n41344" type="main" key="re_si_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsīnācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>resina</etym>, <sense id="n41344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resinous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resinaceous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen (rosmarini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 59, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resinalis: <entryFree id="n41345" type="main" key="re_si_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resinous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:178" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:14:207" default="NO">2, 14, 207</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resinatus: <entryFree id="n41346" type="main" key="re_si_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resined</hi>: vinum, <hi rend="ital">seasoned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flavored with resin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:77:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 77, 8</bibl>; Plin 23, 1, 24, § 46; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 24, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 28, 5</bibl>: juventus, <hi rend="ital">smeared with resin</hi> (to remove the hair and make the skin smooth), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resinosus: <entryFree id="n41347" type="main" key="re_si_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of resin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gummy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resinous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ladanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 30, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 6, 12, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix Brutia (with pinguissima),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:37" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 7, 23, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resinula: <entryFree id="n41348" type="hapax" key="re_si_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsīnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bit of gum</hi>, as frankincense, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 233</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resipio: <entryFree id="n41349" type="main" key="re^si^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sapio</etym>, <sense id="n41349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to savor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taste</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">smack of</hi> something; <hi rend="ital">to have a savor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flavor of</hi> something (class.). </sense><sense id="n41349.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum resipit ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">picem (uva),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam (aqua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 22, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam minimum amaritudinis (taleolae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 48, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41349.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to smack of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savor of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus homo non aptissimus ad jocandum, minimeque resipiens patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istae (comoediae) resipiunt stilum Plautinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n41349.3" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to taste well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have a good flavor</hi>: <pb n="1579" /> <cb n="RESI" /> Iaboravi, ut insulsa resiperent, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Monos. 12 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
resipiscentia: <entryFree id="n41350" type="hapax" key="re^si^piscenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĭpiscentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resipisco</etym>, a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">meta/noia,</foreign> <sense id="n41350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a change of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reformation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repentance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 24, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resipisco: <entryFree id="n41351" type="main" key="re^si^pisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsĭpisco</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi</itype> (resipui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 1</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 897</bibl> P.; or Com. Rel. v. 16 Rib.; <sense id="n41351.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">resipisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">resipisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 80</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">resipiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42</bibl></cit>), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [resipio], <hi rend="ital">to recover one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s senses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self again; to revive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">afferte aquam ... dum resipiscit ... Jam resipisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 24</bibl></cit>, and 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 24, § 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo omnium nunc me fortunatissimum Factum puto esse, gnate, quom te intellego Resipisse,</quote> <trans><tr>are returned to your senses</tr>, <tr>become reasonable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; Afran. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tunc saltem resipiscerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessi resipiscimus aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 24, 17; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a diaboli laqueis,</quote> <trans><tr>escape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 2, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resistentia: <entryFree id="n41352" type="main" key="re^sistentia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsistentia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resisto</etym>, <sense id="n41352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposition</hi> (late Lat. for repugnantia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Pecc. Mer. 2:22" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Pecc. Mer. 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
re: <entryFree id="n41353" type="main" key="re^3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n41353.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stand back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain standing</hi> anywhere (cf. resideo); <hi rend="ital">to stand still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay; to stay behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi> (class.; less freq. than consistere). </sense><sense id="n41353.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: dabo <foreign lang="greek">me/ga kako/n,</foreign> nisi resistis ... Mane ... Mane atque asta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Resiste!</quote> <trans><tr>Stop! Halt!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 10</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso ubinam illic restitit miles modo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi restiteras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus! heus! tibi dico, Chaerea, inquit, restiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ille saepius appellatus aspexit ac restitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec revocantis verba resistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnes municipiorum villarumque amoenitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restitere Romani, tamquam caelesti voce jussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque certum inveniri poterat, obtinendine Brundisii causā ibi remansisset ... an inopiā navium ibi restitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die cum duabus legionibus in occulto restitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jubam revocatum finitimo bello restitisse in regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: Vettius negabat, se umquam cum Curione restitisse, <hi rend="ital">that he had stopped</hi> (to talk), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 2</bibl> (al. constitisse): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est ubi lapsi resistamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 39, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes dat in fugam, sic ut omnino pugnandi causă restiterit nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui restitissent (sc. in urbe),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ante restitit, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernes saepe resistere equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41353.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus nusquam resistens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1</bibl></cit>, praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 744" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Med. 744</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proluvies ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41353.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec resistet (vita) extra fores limenque carceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod optabile, id expetendum: quod expetendum, laudabile: deinde reliqui gradus. Sed ego in hoc resisto,</quote> <trans><tr>I stop at this</tr>, <tr>pause here</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:18:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 18, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 55</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad thalami clausas, Musa, resiste fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipit effari mediāque in voce resistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus ad singula vestigia resistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resistens ac salebrosa oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 46</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba resistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in secundo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:10:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41353.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist; to make opposition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resistance</hi> (so most freq.; cf.: repugno, adversor). </sense><sense id="n41353.5" n="A" level="2"> Esp. in milit. lang., constr. usu. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41353.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum legiones hostibus resisterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper nostris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venientibus, signa inferentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 82</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruptionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentinae Gallorum conjurationi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ulla multitudine in unum locum coactā, resisti posse Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41353.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">resistere neque deprecari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 7 et saep.: acerrime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeco Marte resistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de resistendo cogitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2</bibl></cit>. 34: ibi resistere ac propulsare, Sall. J. <cb n="RESO" /> 51, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">nedum resistendi occasionem fuerit habiturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab nostris eādem ratione quā pridie resistitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">resisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 63</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41353.8" n="B" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia consilia consulatūs mei, quibus illi tribuno plebis pro re publicā restitissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui rei publicae causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiter dolori ac fortunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix dolori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensioni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to reply to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factioni inimicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resistere et repugnare contra veritatem non audet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 17, 51</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus his (sententiis) resistitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:10" default="NO">6, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui nec virtute resisti potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:200 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 200 al.</bibl></cit> — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: restitit et pervicit <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Cic. Att. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">resistentibus collegis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patricii contra vi resistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua sibi statua poneretur, restitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a Cottā primisque ordinibus acriter resisteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix deorum opibus, quin obruatur Romana res, resisti posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41353.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">(plaustra) adversus tempestatem nocentem non resistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(fundamenta) valenter resistent contra ea, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Symplegades) Quae nunc immotae perstant ventisque resistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 339</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indejecta domus tanto malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:288" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices frigori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silex vehementer igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec gemmarum genera scalpturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 30, § 104</bibl></cit>. — Hence, of medicines, <hi rend="ital">to resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act against</hi> a disease: <cit><quote lang="la">amiantus veneficiis resistit omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 31, § 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:152" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 80, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:93 al" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 28, § 93 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis tribunicia libidini restitit consulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ripae fluminis cedunt aut prominentia montium resistunt,</quote> <trans><tr>projecting mountains advance into it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni vis humana resistat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis ac minime resistens ad calamitates perferendas mens eorum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n41353.10" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To rise again</hi> (very rare, and only trop.; syn. resurgo): post ex fluvio fortuna resistet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 47 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est jam, unde nos reficiamus, aut ubi lapsi resistamus,</quote> <trans><tr>we can raise ourselves up</tr>, <tr>rise again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resociandus: <entryFree id="n41354" type="main" key="re^so^ci^andus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏcĭandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [re-socius], <sense id="n41354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be reunited</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Auct. Hypogn. 3, 9, 14.</sense></entryFree>
resolubilis: <entryFree id="n41355" type="main" key="re^so^lu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏlūbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>resolvo</etym>, <sense id="n41355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be dissolved again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resoluble</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caementum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cath. 10, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines luti corruptione resolubiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 13, § 20.</sense></entryFree>
resolute: <entryFree id="n41356" type="main" key="re^so^lu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏlūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. resolvo, <sense id="n41356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
resolutio: <entryFree id="n41357" type="main" key="re^so^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resolvo</etym>, <sense id="n41357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an untying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbinding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosening</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n41357.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a slackening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaxing; a laxness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris, stomachi, nervorum, oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1</bibl>; 3, 27, 1; 6, 6, 36.— </sense><sense id="n41357.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41357.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A making void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cancelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41357.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A solution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sophismatis,</quote> <trans><tr>an explanation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 10</bibl></cit> (dub.). — </sense><sense id="n41357.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resolutus: <entryFree id="n41358" type="main" key="re^so^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of resolvo.</entryFree>
resolvo: <entryFree id="n41359" type="main" key="re^solvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-solvo</orth>, <itype>solvi, sŏlūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to untie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbind; to loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; cf.: relaxo, resero, recludo, libero). </sense><sense id="n41359.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41359.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <trans><tr>to unyoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:180" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 180</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta juga leonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem suā sponte vinxerit, non resolvat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:22" default="NO">11, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinctas vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 382</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila,</quote> <trans><tr>to loose</tr>, <tr>separate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>to unbind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:49" default="NO">49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oras,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast loose from the shore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19, 10</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem catenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to release</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 737</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crura vinclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) resoluta capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra,</quote> <trans><tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulum mucrone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:643" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum in diversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces haec in verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 282</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectato Ora sono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit>, <cb n="RESO" /> 126: <cit><quote lang="la">fatis ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 452</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis aurum resolvit,</quote> <trans><tr>melts</tr>, <tr>dissolves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:967" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 967</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivem,</quote> <trans><tr>to melt</tr>, <tr>thaw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">resolutus repente Rhenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">margaritas in tabem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebam in pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:60" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos,</quote> <trans><tr>to melt down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulas ventis ac sole,</quote> <trans><tr>to disperse</tr>, <tr>dissipate</tr>, <tr>scatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 400</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tenebras (sidere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resoluta caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 58</bibl></cit>: Zephyro se glaeba, <hi rend="ital">becomes loose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra resoluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:5" default="NO">11, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros ariete,</quote> <trans><tr>to break down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:553" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinctos muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:495" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:369" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 369</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41359.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41359.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To relax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnerve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enervate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enfeeble</hi> the body (cf. remitto): <cit><quote lang="la">felicitas hos inflat, illos mollit et totos resolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cerberus) immania terga resolvit Fusus humi,</quote> <trans><tr>stretched out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nexos artus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque (concubitus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus (somno),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placitā resoluta quiete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:468" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra ad molles choros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 42; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigatione resolutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:10" default="NO">9, 5, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41359.5" n="2" level="3"> Mostly ante-class., <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi> a debt: <cit><quote lang="la">minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vecturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 144, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">145, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">148, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum boni viri arbitratu resolvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 149, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41359.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41359.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (acc. to I. A.), <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release; to disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay open; to annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (syn. rescindo): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsas periodos majoribus intervallis et velut laxioribus nodis resolvemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:127" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam, quā fieri quicquid posset ratione, resolvi,</quote> <trans><tr>have disclosed</tr>, <tr>shown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque piacula nulla resolvent,</quote> <trans><tr>release</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amore resolutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:83" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibal) Quod sponte abscedat tandemque resolvat Ausoniam,</quote> <trans><tr>liberate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:206" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resoluta legibus urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira resoluta frenis legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem quod lite resolvit,</quote> <trans><tr>does away with</tr>, <tr>ends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitat genialis hiems curasque resolvit,</quote> <trans><tr>banishes</tr>, <tr>dispels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 15, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolos tecti ambagesque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>find the way through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura (pudoris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolos fraudesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:153" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:508" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphiboliam,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy</tr>, <tr>remove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta ex parte diversā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>refute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal et onera commerciorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to abolish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:5:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 2, 2</bibl></cit> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n41359.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to I. B.). </sense><sense id="n41359.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To relax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soften</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam militarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem § 12. — </sense><sense id="n41359.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unā plagā (cf. I. B. 2. supra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 38</bibl>, the correct reading is persoluturum). — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">relaxed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enervated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora juvenum (with fluxa), Col. praef. § 17: minister Idaeo resolutior cinaedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:98" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41359.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhampered</hi>: os, Val.Max. 8, 7, ext. 1.— </sense><sense id="n41359.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unbridled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:305" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 305</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏlūtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without restraint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo resolutius decachinnetis,</quote> <trans><tr>more unrestrainedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resonabilis: <entryFree id="n41360" type="main" key="re^so^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>resono</etym>, <sense id="n41360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resounding;</hi> a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Echo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 358</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 99, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resonantia: <entryFree id="n41361" type="main" key="re^so^nanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an echo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resonatio: <entryFree id="n41362" type="main" key="re^so^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resonance</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 150, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resono: <entryFree id="n41363" type="main" key="re^so^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sŏno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype> (ante-class. collat. form, acc. to the 3d conj., resonit, Pac. and Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 30 sq.</bibl>: resonunt, Enn. and Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 838</bibl> P.; of the <sense id="n41363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> only resonavit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 567</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ring again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n41363.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41363.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum clupei resonunt, Enn. l. l. (Ann. v. 364 Vahl.): valvae resonunt regiae, Att. l. l.: theatrum naturā ita resonans, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum sic e poculo ejecit, ut id resonaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi non resonent imagines,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where no echoes are heard</tr>, <tr>without echoes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum frustra resonant aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 333</bibl></cit>: resonabat eburnea Telorum custos<pb n="1580" /> <cb n="RESP" />  (i. e. pharetra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:320" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 320</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut solent pleni resonare camini,</quote> <trans><tr>to send forth a roaring noise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eque sacrā resonant examina quercu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum clamor et tubarum sonus amplior quam editur resonare solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:6:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resonantia litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:491" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 491</bibl></cit>. — With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore et gemitu templum resonit caelitum, Att. ap. Non. l. l.: aura crepitu musico, Pac. l. l.: late plangoribus aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus undique magno strepitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latratibus aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula plausu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:668" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avibus virgulta canoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusta cicadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 13</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litoraque alcyonen resonant, acalanthida dumi,</quote> <trans><tr>resound with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudo septem nervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox ima quattuor chordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (cornus) ad nervos resonant in cantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suave locus voci resonat conclusus,</quote> <trans><tr>echoes to the voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: carmina resonantia chordis Romanis, <hi rend="ital">to the strings</hi>, Auct. Pan. ad Pis. 229. — </sense><sense id="n41363.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vocibus nostrorum oratorum recinit quiddam et resonat urbanius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 171</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 30</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria virtuti resonat tamquam imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41363.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give back the sound of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">formosam resonare doces Amaryllida silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">triste et acutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resonent mihi Cynthia silvae,</quote> <trans><tr>call out to me</tr>, <tr>Cynthia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora Hylan semper resonantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:18" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:30" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 30</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sonus) in fidibus testudine resonatur aut cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <case>acc.</case> of a place, <hi rend="ital">to make resound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Solis filia lucos Assiduo resonat cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41363.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To say urgently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continually</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vernacula principi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resonus: <entryFree id="n41364" type="main" key="re^so^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>resono</etym>, <sense id="n41364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echoing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:618" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:285" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resonas plaudere caetras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:348" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 348</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41365" type="main" key="re^so^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resonance; a resounding</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:105" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
resopio: <entryFree id="n41366" type="main" key="re^so_pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sōpĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put to sleep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tricerberum mellitis resopit offulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Cont.
