Virg. p. 156</bibl></cit> Munk.</sense></entryFree>
resorbeo: <entryFree id="n41367" type="main" key="re^sorbe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-sorbĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suck back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallow again</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque vomit fluctus totidem totidemque resorbet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 125</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">saxa (pontus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 627</bibl></cit> Wagn.: <cit><quote lang="la">mare in se resorberi videbamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare accrescere aut resorberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te rursus in bellum resorbens Unda fretis tulit aestuosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamum (opp. egerunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 43, 67, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lapidis aestus) respuit ab se Atque per aes agitat, sine eo quod saepe resorbet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>draws to itself</tr>, <tr>attracts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1054" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1054</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <trans><tr>to suck in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carptim vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletum,</quote> <trans><tr>to suppress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:594" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 594</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1286" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1286</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:654" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 654</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
respectio: <entryFree id="n41368" type="main" key="respecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">respectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>respicio</etym>, <sense id="n41368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a review</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animarum sanctarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the judgment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
respecto: <entryFree id="n41369" type="main" key="respecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">respecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n41369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to look back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look round</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behind repeatedly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gaze about; to look at</hi> any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n41369.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41369.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid respectas? nihil pericli est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi respectantes hostium antesignanos vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 630</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respectans abit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:729" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 729</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:377" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 377</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respecto identidem, ne senex, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">identidem, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti janua patet immani et vasto respectat hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 375</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41369.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatore arcem Romanam respectante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera respectans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine fine Caesarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium (alius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:594" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 594</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41369.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cast a look behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wait; to wait for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expect; to care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41369.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum haec ita praetereamus, ut tamen intuentes et respectantes relinquamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: animus non me deserens, sed respectans in ea loca discessit, id. <cb n="RESP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:23:84" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 23, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciti respectabant somnoque sepulti, Dum, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>waited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:974" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 974</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41369.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua pios respectant numina,</quote> <trans><tr>regard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque hoc liberis nostris interdicendum est, ne observent tribules suos ... ne par ab iis munus in suā petitione respectent,</quote> <trans><tr>look for</tr>, <tr>expect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
respectus: <entryFree id="n41370" type="main" key="respectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">respectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of respicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41371" type="main" key="respectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">respectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>respicio</etym>, <sense id="n41371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41371.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientibus miserabilem respectum incendiorum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine respiratione ac respectu pugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effuse ac sine respectu fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine respectu mea fata relinquens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 226</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41371.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a refuge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asylum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respectum pulcherrimum et praesidium firmissimum adimit rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 44</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum respectum praeterquam victoriam nobis abscindamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23</bibl></cit>.: <cit><quote lang="la">in idolis nationum non erit respectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41371.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi> (cf. ratio; in this signif. rare before the Aug. per., and usu. in <case>abl.</case>; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite word of Liv.): respectum ad senatum et ad bonos non habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni respectus equitum praepedisset animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanorum maxime respectus civitates movit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:28:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 28, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respectum amicitiae habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 1</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: respectu, <hi rend="ital">by a regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with regard;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factione respectuque rerum privatarum Appius vicit,</quote> <trans><tr>by a regard for private interests</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 46</bibl>; 42, 9; 45, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:100" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respectu cupiunt hic tamen esse sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 9, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:4:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 4, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illius respectum iste populo praesideat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:32:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine respectu non majestatis modo sed etiam humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine respectu pudoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3</bibl> (7), 23, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">sine respectu veniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:9:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine respectu sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecum proverbium jactans: occultae musicae nullum esse respectum,</quote> <trans><tr>is in no repute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">musicam quae sit abscondita, eam esse nullius rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 3</bibl></cit>; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">th=s lanqanou/shs mousikh=s ou)dei\s lo/gos</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
respergo: <entryFree id="n41372" type="main" key="re_spergo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-spergo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sprinkle over</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to besprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestrew</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n41372.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoris oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus, os, simulacrum sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morientium sanguine os uxoris respersum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 230</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae respersae sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:452" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 452</bibl></cit>: caede fraternā juvenis respersus, Cat 64, 181; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sanguine nefando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid fuerat mortale aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 604</bibl></cit>: vino rogum ne respargito, Lex Numae ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 12, 14, § 88</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=262" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 262</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicubi labi necesse est, alicubi respergi,</quote> <trans><tr>to be splashed</tr>, <tr>spattered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: pelagus respergit, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: cum primum Aurora respergit lumine terras, Lucr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1, 25</bibl> (cf. spargit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 144</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">nullā nube respersus jubar,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>beclouded</tr>, <tr>dimmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 723" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 723</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n41372.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nux repercussa radicem respergat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 15</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41372.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to besprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bespatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">servili probro respersus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem infamiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 18:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 18, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41373" type="main" key="re_spergo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspergo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. respergo</etym>, <sense id="n41373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a besprinkling</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">marmoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 503</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
respersio: <entryFree id="n41374" type="main" key="re_spersi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspersĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprinkling over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besprinkling</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">pigmentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sumptuosa respersio,</quote> <trans><tr>a sprinkling of the funeral pile with wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60</bibl></cit>; v. 1. respergo, I.</sense></entryFree>
respersus: <entryFree id="n41375" type="main" key="re_spersus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 1. respergo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41376" type="main" key="re_spersus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspersus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. respergo</etym>, <sense id="n41376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprinkling over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besprinkling</hi> (only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">pinnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 163</bibl></cit> dub. (Jan.: urinā adspersā). <cb n="RESP" /></sense></entryFree>
respiciens: <entryFree id="n41377" type="main" key="re_spi^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, and <sense id="n41377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.;</hi> v. respicio.</sense></entryFree>
respicio: <entryFree id="n41378" type="main" key="re_spi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>spexi, spectum, 3</itype> (old form of <sense id="n41378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subj. perf.</hi> respexis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 16</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look; to see behind one; to look back upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for</hi> any thing (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n41378.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41378.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respicere quasi retro aspicere, Varro Manio: sedens ... neque post respiciens, neque ante prospiciens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 442, 31 sq.</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">longe retro respicere non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 22, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito exaudivit hinnitum respexitque et equum alacrem laetus aspexit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.: Er.</hi> Ergasilum qui vocat? <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Respice ... respice ad me, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:54 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 54 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 61</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 13 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte ad oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae ad oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:45" default="NO">11, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad laevam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta militum virtus fuit, ut non modo de vallo decederet nemo, sed paene ne respiceret quidem quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transque caput jace, nec respexeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respicit Aeneas subito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tergo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod respicere vetitus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41378.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (in lit. sense rare in good prose, but freq. in all styles in the trop. signif.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi Respiciunt atram in nimbo volitare favillam,</quote> <trans><tr>look back on</tr>, <tr>see behind them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo Prospicit occasus, interdum respicit ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respice me et relinque egentem parasitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudia istos comites atque hoc respice et revortere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima respiciens signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibalem) respexisse saepe Italiae litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prius amissam (Creüsam) respexi animumve reflexi, Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2</bibl></cit>. 741; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 491</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 66</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut stetit et frustra absentem respexit amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instantem tergo Cloanthum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec versas ad litora puppes Respiciunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 269</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 666</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis pignora cara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: medio cum Sol altissimus orbe Tantum respiceret, quantum superesse videret, <hi rend="ital">looked back upon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had already passed over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 354</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41378.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41378.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn attention.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41378.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque se in multa simul intendere animus totum potest: et, quocumque respexit, desinit intueri, quod propositum erat,</quote> <trans><tr>at whatsoever it looks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si propter singula verba ad singulas formas respiciendum erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non respiciendum ad haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Bibulus cuncta administrabat: ad hunc summa imperii respiciebat,</quote> <trans><tr>looked to him</tr>, <tr>was centred in him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum (emptionis) ad venditorem respicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 6, 4</bibl></cit> (with ad venditorem pertinere). — </sense><sense id="n41378.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom respicias immensi temporis omne Praeteritum spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 854</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad longissime potest mens mea respicere spatium praeteriti temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: cum vastitatem Italiae respexerint, Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 1</bibl>: subsidia, quae respicerent in re trepidā, etc., <hi rend="ital">which they might look to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from which they might expect aid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 46</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne respicere spem ullam ab Romanis posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respicere exemplar vitae morumque jubebo Doctum imitatorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to look at</tr>, <tr>have in his eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de te pendentis, te respicientis amici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 105</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sit prius actum, respicere aetas Nostra nequit, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1446</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:972" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 972</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respiciens, an vera soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:661" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 661</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41378.8" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to look at with solicitude</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have a care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be mindful of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, etc. (in this sense mostly <hi rend="ital">act.;</hi> cf. provideo). </sense><sense id="n41378.9" n="1" level="3"> Of a protecting deity: <cit><quote lang="la">di homines respiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus respiciet nos aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quis nos deus respexerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1581" /> <cb n="RESP" /> Sive neglectum genus et nepotes Respicis auctor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi idem deus, qui, etc., respexerit rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et me et te, nisi quid dī respiciunt, perdidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēspĭcĭens</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the Provident</hi>, an epithet of Fortuna: <cit><quote lang="la">ad opem ferendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 477</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1766</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Rarely, in a bad sense, of an avenging deity: at vos, devota capita, respiciant di perjuriorum vindices,</quote> <trans><tr>may they remember it against you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41378.10" n="2" level="3"> Of persons that have a care or regard for any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">hercle alius nemo respicit nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, me in tuis secundis respice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseros aratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin Caesarem respiciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:10:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non Pylium Nestora respicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum quisque ferat respiciendus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: mox deos respexere; <cit><quote lang="la">restitui Capitolium placuit,</quote> <trans><tr>bethought themselves of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani commoda (with prospicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:55:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 55, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem cum meam tum aliorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Planc 38, 91</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1159</bibl></cit> et saep. —With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to think of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">have regard for one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 79</bibl>; id. pro Scaur. Fragm. 41, p. 267 Orell.: quod si Caesar se respexerit, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 8</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (Quintilian): <cit><quote lang="la">ad utilitatem Ligarii respicit,</quote> <trans><tr>looks to the advantage of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">modice ad hanc partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecas litteras (corresp. to studere Latinis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepius ad curam rerum ab elocutione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 120</bibl></cit>.—With an <hi rend="ital">abstr. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid pietas antiqua labores Respicit humanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 689</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respicio nihili meam vos gratiam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
respiraculum: <entryFree id="n41379" type="main" key="re_spi_ra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspīrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>respiro</etym>, <sense id="n41379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respiration</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
respiramen: <entryFree id="n41380" type="main" key="re_spi_ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspīrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the windpipe</hi> (Ovid.): <cit><quote lang="la">respiramen iterque Eripiunt animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 142</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">respiramina claudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:828" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 828</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
respiramentum: <entryFree id="n41381" type="main" key="re_spi_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspīrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id. II.</etym>, <sense id="n41381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comfort</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Serm. Temp. 144 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
respiratio: <entryFree id="n41382" type="main" key="re_spi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspīrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>respiro</etym>. <sense id="n41382.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a breathing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaling;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respiration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 67</bibl> (with spiritus); 11, 3, 39; 53; 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:3:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:32:167" default="NO">2, 32, 167</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n41382.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">exhalation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41382.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi> in the course of an action, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a taking breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resting; an intermission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suo quisque gradu obnixi sine respiratione ac respectu pugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38</bibl></cit>.—So of a <hi rend="ital">pause</hi> in speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">morae respirationesque delectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:49" default="NO">11, 3, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
respiratus: <entryFree id="n41383" type="main" key="re_spi_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspīrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhaling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspiration;</hi> only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl> (dub. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> Bait. intrante spiritu), and <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 149, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
respiro: <entryFree id="n41384" type="main" key="re_spi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-spīro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n41384.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathe back; to breathe out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. in the trop. signif.): quod nisi respirent venti, vis nulla refrenet Res ... nunc quia respirant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:568 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 568 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aspera arteria ad pulmones usque pertineat excipiatque animam eam, quae ducta sit spiritu eandemque a pulmonibus respiret et reddat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eā pars redditur respirando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malignum aëra,</quote> <trans><tr>to exhale</tr>, <tr>send forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:78" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 35</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:74" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41384.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to take breath; to breathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respire</hi> (only <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n41384.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius fore eos ad respirandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine respirem, quaeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit> (with recipere anhelitum); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 12</bibl>: O Clitopho, timeo. <hi rend="ital">Clit.</hi> respiro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non ter deciens respiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:28 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 28 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n41384.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fetch one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s breath again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recover breath; to recover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be relieved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refreshed</hi> <cb n="RESP" /> after any thing difficult (as labor, care, etc.); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab aliquā re.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41384.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(improbitas) cujus in animo versatur, numquam sinit eum respirare, numquam acquiescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si armis positis civitas respiraverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit> (with recreari): <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot negotiis distentus sit, ut libere respirare non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respiravi, liberatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines respirasse videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 13</bibl>, a, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 1: spatium respirandi dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 26</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 28, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:813 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 813 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo animi respirant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 62</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita respiratum, mittique legationes coeptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41384.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respirare a metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 23, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eorum mixtis precibus minisque, Liv 4, 25: a continuis cladibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aures poëticis voluptatibus a forensi asperitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41384.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, twice in Cic., of the exertion or passion itself, <hi rend="ital">to abate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">remittere, cessare): oppugnatio respiravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas atque avaritia respirasset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resplendentia: <entryFree id="n41385" type="hapax" key="re_splendenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēsplendentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>resplendeo</etym>, <sense id="n41385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resplendence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Maced. 55" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Maced. 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
resplendeo: <entryFree id="n41386" type="main" key="re_splende^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-splendĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine brightly; to glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be resplendent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fulvā resplendent fragmina harenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 741</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:732" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 732</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 446</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 543" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 543</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 17, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">resplendet gloria Martis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
respondeo: <entryFree id="n41387" type="main" key="re_sponde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē-spondĕo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41387.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in return</hi> for something else; <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">present in return.</hi> So, only in a few examples, the phrase par pari (<case>dat.</case>) respondere, <hi rend="ital">to return like for like</hi>: par pari respondes dicto, <hi rend="ital">you return tit for tat with your tongue</hi> (syn. refero), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 41</bibl>; cf.: istuc serva; et verbum verbo par pari ut respondeas, Ter Phorm. 1, 4, 35; and: <cit><quote lang="la">paria paribus respondimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: provide, si cui quid debetur, ut sit, unde par pari respondeatur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that there be wherewithal to meet the demand</hi>, Atticus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 6</bibl>; cf. also under II. A. 1, the lusus verbb. with spondeo; and II. B. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n41387.1" n="II" level="1"> In a more general signification. </sense><sense id="n41387.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respond</hi> (either to a question, or to any statement or remark, and either in a friendly or hostile signif.); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid alicui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contra aliquem</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>). </sense><sense id="n41387.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n41387.4" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Aliud te rogo. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Aliud ergo nunc tibi respondeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 70</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 73</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius respondes, quam rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā legatione Papirius auditā ... respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 40, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 38, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille appellatus respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:62:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 62, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 24, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 14, 2. — So usu. of an oral answer: tibi non rescribam, sed respondeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also of writing: epistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his sermo oritur, respondet Laelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 28</bibl>: olli respondit rex Albaï Longaï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> p. 2691</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 34 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cui orationi Caepionis ore respondit Aelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:169" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremae tuae paginae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui opinioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam aequae postulationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:47 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 47 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā constantiā ad ea, quae quaesita erant, respondebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrabar me satis respondisse ad id quod quaesierat Laelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:39:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 39, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec absurde adversus utrosque respondisse visus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus haec imperator respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 35</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— With <hi rend="ital">acc. of neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud respondere cogam,</quote> <trans><tr>to make answer to that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa contra patronos venuste testis saepe respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:24" default="NO">5, 7, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe, quid contra juvenis responderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 233</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondent, bello se et suos tutari posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2</bibl>. 102 al. —Introducing a direct answer: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dixisset, Quid agis, Grani? respondit, Immo vero tu, Druse, quid agis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; id. <cb n="RESP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:5:21:12" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 5, 21, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Inv. 1:31:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Tusc. 5:19:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 56</bibl>.— In <hi rend="ital">impers. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam mihi responsum est, abeo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 93</bibl>: quid nunc renunciem abs te responsum? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic existimet: Responsum non dictum esse, quia laesit prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. prol. 6</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ejus et in senatu et in foro vel provisa prudenter vel acta constanter vel responsa acute ferebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— In the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(haec) quam brevia responsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— In a lusus verbb. with spondeo: <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Sponden' tu istud? <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Spondeo. <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> At ego, tuum tibi advenisse filium, respondeo, <hi rend="ital">and in return I promise you</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">assure you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 119</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fideiussores, qui salvam rempublicam fore responderunt, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>promised</tr>, <tr>gave assurance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41387.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa et solitudines voci respondent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">respondent flebile ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 53</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">respondentia tympana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 175</bibl></cit>: urbes coloniarum respondebunt Catilinae tumulis silvestribus, <hi rend="ital">will give an answer to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will prove a match for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41387.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41387.7" n="a" level="4"> Of lawyers, priests, oracles, etc., <hi rend="ital">to give an opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">response</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeris, num juris consultus (sit)? quasi quisquam sit, qui sibi hunc falsum de jure respondisse dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 30, 113</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de jure consulentibus respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in a like signif., also simply jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas respondendi juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:15:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 15, 3 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civica jura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quae consuluntur, minimo periculo respondentur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:89:306" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 89, 306</bibl>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 7</bibl>; and so very freq. of the jurists in the Digests; <cit><quote lang="la">v. responsum: pater Roscii ad haruspices retulit: qui responderunt, nihil illo puero clarius fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex prodigiis haruspices respondissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:24:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberantibus Pythia respondit, ut moenibus ligneis se munirent,</quote> <trans><tr>gave advice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:11:section=11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 11, § 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possumus seniores amici quiete respondere,</quote> <trans><tr>to give advice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n41387.8" n="b" level="4"> Of the answering of a person summoned when his name is called; hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi>: citatus neque respondit neque excusatus est, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cives, qui ad nomina non respondissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia Romae non respondebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 36</bibl> (vadato, <case>dat.</case>, i.e. ei qui eum vadatus erat; v. vador); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:14" default="NO">41, 1, 14</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n41387.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi> before a tribunal, <hi rend="ital">to answer</hi> an accusation, <hi rend="ital">meet</hi> a charge, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">perfectus in exsilium Tubulus est nec respondere ausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verrem alterā actione responsurum non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo Epaminondam responsurum putabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41387.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be present</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi (sc. paeon et herous) se offerent et respondebunt non vocati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba (with res se ostendent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ii, qui debent, non respondeant ad tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">podagra ad tempus (with venit ad horam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis per menstrua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41387.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To answer to; to meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accord</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">correspond with</hi> a thing; constr. usually with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia omnibus paribus paria respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut horum auctoritatibus illorum orationi, qui dissentiunt, respondere posse videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:23:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 23, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verba verbis quasi demensa et paria respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">respondent extrema primis, media utrisque, omnia omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>: (Aristoteles dicit) illam artem (sc. rhetoricam) quasi ex alterā parte respondere dialecticae, <hi rend="ital">that it corresponds to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forms the counterpart of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificare alteram porticum quae Palatio responderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 23, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of a locality: contra elata mari respondet Gnosia tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lies opposite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pachyni pulsata Ionio respondent saxa profundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:73" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est mihi magnae curae, ut ita erudiatur (Lucullus), ut et patri et Caepioni nostro et tibi tam propinquo respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: satis Graecorum <pb n="1582" /> <cb n="RESP" /> gloriae responderunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua virtus opinioni hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna meis optatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seges votis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Caesaris non responsura lacertis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favor meritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne prior officio quisquam respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par fama labori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:641" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mihi respondent veteres in carmine vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:197 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 197 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam nemo speciosiorem producet, sed hominibus non respondet,</quote> <trans><tr>he does not pay his debts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amori amore respondere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to return it</tr>, <tr>repay it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinti fratris liberalitati subsidiis amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex vico ortus est, eam patriam intellegitur habere, cui reipublicae vicus ille respondet,</quote> <trans><tr>to which it belongs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In mal. part.: mulieribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere ad parentum speciem,</quote> <trans><tr>resemble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformentur directiones, ut longitudines ad regulam et lineam, altitudines ad perpendiculum, anguli ad normam respondentes exigantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">structuram ad perpendiculum respondere oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia non tota ad animum responderat (villa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad spem eventus respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Papirio quoque brevi ad spem eventus respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid non ex voluntate respondet, iram provocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculum quocumque obvertimus oris, Res sibi respondent simili formā atque colore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>correspond</tr>, <tr>are reflected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 167</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera respondent in aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia raro verba belle respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: medicus aliquid oportet inveniat, quod non ubique fortasse, sed saepius tamen etiam respondeat, <hi rend="ital">may answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be suitable</hi>, Cels. praef.—</sense><sense id="n41387.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta quando cum quarto responderint (sc. colono),</quote> <trans><tr>have returned</tr>, <tr>yielded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. with <case>abl.</case> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus cum est repetita cultu, magno fenore colono respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis, nisi praepingui solo, non respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">metalla plenius responsura fodienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēspon-sum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">response</hi> (equally freq. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n41387.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">suis postulatis responsa exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
