C. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec paucis diebus ex illius ad nostra responsa responsis intellegentur, quorsum evasura sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine responso legatos dimisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo ab nostris dato responso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum dedisti tantis de rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 39, § 85</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dare responsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 32, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 5</bibl>, ext. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">triste redditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre (ab aliquo),</quote> <trans><tr>to receive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">referre (ab aliquo),</quote> <trans><tr>to deliver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:23" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:55" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum non fuit in eis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41387.14" n="2" level="3"> In partic. (acc. to II. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">an answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi> of a lawyer, priest, oracle, etc.; <hi rend="ital">an opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">response</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oracle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum responsumque ab eo (Crasso) verum magis, quam ad suam rem accommodatum abstulisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res judicatae, decreta, responsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">The responsa prudentium, or authoritative opinions of leading lawyers, were an important source of the Roman law,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit> Sandars ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspicum responsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>;
